reviews.text: What. happened. to. this. place?<br><br>It was really hot yesterday.  It was the heatwave.  So, when we got in there, we were expecting they would be blasting the air conditioner... This wasn&#39;t the case.  We were informed it would be a 15 minute wait, and to be honest, I wasn&#39;t in the mood for that, and was ready to go anywhere else in the mall-  My date insisted, and my crabby-butt begrudgingly agreed, throwing shade.<br><br>I&#39;d basically decided on a burger, before we were even seated, because it&#39;s something you typically can&#39;t screw up at a place like this.  My date talked about the burrito, and I warned them it was a bad decision, but they were *all about* it, and said they&#39;d enjoyed it in the past.  Did I mention I had a bad feeling about this place, and didn&#39;t want to go here? ;-)<br>When my food arrived (just mine) I tried some fries.  They weren&#39;t cold, but they tasted like they&#39;d been sitting in an oven?  Or like they&#39;d been toasting under a warmer.  Ugh.  This pissed me off.  The Cheesecake factory isn&#39;t cheap.  When you charge a certain amount of money for your entrees, and there&#39;s always a wait for a table, you don&#39;t DO STUFF like this.  The burger: cooked to a nice medium rare, but the bun was soggy, the lettuce was wilted to the point of tissue paper, and it was obvious it&#39;d been sitting. Oh well?<br><br>When my date&#39;s food arrived, they asked if I&#39;d like to try some:  Sure.  They cut it open, and as you&#39;ll see in the pics, we found a rice burrito, with a few pieces of chicken meat inside.  This ruined the rest of my mood for the night.  I&#39;ll repeat myself:  When you charge a certain amount of money for your entrees, you can&#39;t get away with this.  Maybe they had new cooks?  Maybe they were running out of proteins and rationing them? Maybe this is just the signs of a chain on the decline.  Either way, it&#39;s inexcusable.  When we flat-out asked them to take the burrito off the bill, the manager seemed put-off by the request;  No, we *picked* the chicken out of it, dude!  Ugh.<br><br>The wait staff were decent, that&#39;s what the stars are for, but I won&#39;t come back.  <br><br>What happened to this place?
It was amazing! Our waiter was very polite! He was coming back around in a timely manner &amp; did everything to accommodate us &amp; our child!

Always my go to for cheesecake, specifically strawberry cheesecake. This visit disappointed me a bit. The lady who took my order didn&#39;t act like she wanted to take my order and after I signed my card payment she didn&#39;t care to look at me or to say to have a seat, it will be a minute. I had to ask her and she replied &#34;yep.&#34; She acted as if I had did something wrong to her. I observed her interaction with everyone else she acted somber and didn&#39;t seem all too excited about her job, although she has a sweet voice and nice face. She called out someone&#39;s order half lazily and then mine. She is either working too much or needs a break to find some happiness and cheer. <br><br>As for my cheesecake, it is as delicious as ever although I see my slice has shrunk. Lol. I still can&#39;t finish the whole slice either way. I might have to buy the whole cake next time. <br><br>All in all, my service wasn&#39;t great but my cheesecake is still tasty.

When it comes to the casual dining segment you have your typical choices which consist of Applebee&#39;s (a Denny&#39;s that serves alcohol), Buffalo Wild Wings (a Denny&#39;s with paper plates but big televisions), Red Robin&#39;s (a Denny&#39;s that serves mainly burgers, fries, and alcohol), Hooter&#39;s (a Denny&#39;s with females wearing hardly anything), Old Chicago (a CiCi&#39;s Pizza that has a full bar), and Ruby Tuesday&#39;s (which has more empty tables than most Denny&#39;s) just to name a few.<br><br>There are about another six casual theme chains that are near the top of the class, however, one stands out: The Cheesecake Factory!<br><br>First, the restaurants are huge, however, the wait times are still crazy.  Second, the menu.  It is by far the most diverse menu I&#39;ve ever seen.  Their appetizer&#39;s are awesome (try the spring rolls). They have sandwiches (try the BLT with shrimp that is sometimes off the menu but they can still make it), seafood, pastas, steaks, chicken, and salads. Third, the service set the standard and the casual themed restaurants should take note to see how it is done.  Fourth, their desserts.  You go there for the cheesecake and they have a countless number of variety.<br><br>That is all the positives.  Now here are the downsides....<br><br>First, wait times can be long as I have remember waits in excess of three hours on a weekend.  Solution to that is go shop.  Second, because their menu is so vast, I ALWAYS have issues deciding what app, what entree, and what dessert. Third, if I worked in the kitchen I would be very unhappy because I could never remember a menu that vast from the back-of-house (kitchen) perspective.

The food was what I expected, not amazing but not horrible. The portions were large and the free bread is always a treat. The drinks were very overpriced. The food was also kind of speedy for what it was. I do enjoy the &#34;skinnylicious&#34; menú but hate calling it that. There are many good low cal options on it though. Wouldn&#39;t choose to eat here over somewhere else.

I have not been to the Cheesecake Factory for the food before. I loved the food and I was impressed. The decor is a little quirky but it works.<br><br>Raspberry Lemonade-Very sour but better towards bottom of the drink.<br><br>Table bread- Very nice and I love the pat of butter with it.<br><br>Mac and Cheese bites-  This appetizer was asolutely delicious. It was perfectly crunchy with a very nice creamy mac inside. Also the sauce along with it is very good.<br><br>Chicken parmesan pizza style-  The chicken is as big as your plate. It was very good I like chicken parmesan. I like the cheese and angel hair on it.<br><br>Lemon raspberry cheesecake- This was delicious and different taste for cheesecake. The lemon and raspberry are tart the you have sweet cheesecake. It was perfect as well as the whip cream on the side.

This place is a very nice place to eat at. When you get in, they give you some nice bread and butter. The place has a very nice atmosphere, and looks great. The food was decent. I got the Americano Burger, my one complain was there was way too much grease. Other than that, it was good. The fries are hot and crisp and very good! <br><br>Now for what everybody&#39;s favorite part of the meal is: The Cheescake. I got my go to cheescake, the Oreo Dream Extreme Cheesecake. It is very good and chocolaty and it has a large Oreo on the top. I would very much recommend this one.<br><br>Overall, this place is a good place to eat, and a great experience! I highly recommend this place to everybody. I would rate this place 8/10, and I am defiantly coming again!

Went to go celebrate my brother&#39;s graduation and as usual there was excellent service and there was surprisingly a lot of good vegetarian options! My brother got the veggie burger, my sister got the avocado spring rolls and I got the cold pasta with veggies. It did not have a sauce but was truly delicious!

Not sure if it&#39;s due to COVID or the fact that it was Monday, but it was a bit slow and perfect for a date night. My wife and I went for our one year anniversary dinner. The waitress asked all the right questions from the start and was always friendly and smiling (I could tell even with a mask on), I believer her name was Lauren. The food wasn&#39;t anything too crazy, but it was up to par and delicious nonetheless. Of course this place is famous for their cakes, I definitely enjoyed the chocolate truffle cake. One slice is more than enough for two to share

Cheesecake Factory asked me to submit a review on their website after my Yelp review.  That was 10 days ago and I still haven&#39;t heard back.  Not only was the food bad but the customer service seems to be lacking too.

The ambiance and seating are ideal for larger groups. Our server, Ryan was extremely patient with my table and provided exceptional service. All those who came to our table were very friendly. <br><br>I know some maybe thrown off by the prices, but it&#39;s worth it. Their portions are large and everything is delicious. The hard part is deciding what to order from their extensive menu. <br><br>They offer amazing cheesecakes too. Most never have room for dessert, but I recommend you order it to go at least. You won&#39;t regret a sweet treat later in the evening.

So disappointing after ten years of meals. Hope it was only the one day. Waitstaff was great but food was no good. Almost sent it back. Chicken piccata lunch portion. The pasta was dry, sticky and almost felt like it was reheated in a microwave. It overshadowed the chicken which was ok but shot the balance of what could have been a good meal. Instead, took home for children - they&#39;ll eat anything.  I ordered a side salad and called it lunch. The beet salad was realIt&#39;ll be awhile before I return. I was very  disappointed.<br><br>Visited again. Ordered something good but the music was loud and not conducive to table discussion. Loud singing. Asked that music level be turned down.

Greeted nicely, with all the open booths and tables they picked the smallest one to put us in, which was odd but it worked out as our waitress was great. She guided us through the menu pointing out not only brunch but where the lunch specials were. She was great for questions always smiling and friendly. Since we took a while looking over their 21 page menu, she went to get us bread, which then she apologized for because it was in the oven. Madison was her name I would as for her again of we came back.<br>When the bread came it was so warm we were so excited but they bring you cold hard butter, how is that supposed to spread on bread, especially warm bread?<br>I got the 2 egg breakfast with potatoes and their brioche bread as toast, which was good. Again with the cold butter, but I let the warm butter melt it. My companion got the everything flatbread pizza. Which he said it was ok, but it wasn&#39;t very flat. He thought the veggies made it more went so he would skip that next time, know he is a meat puzza guy. <br>We didn&#39;t get dessert, I know gow could you not. But the bill came fast when we said we were done and she ran the card fast so not bad. Would go again for the breakfast for sure. They have happy hour starting at 4 in the bar area Mon - Fri.

Went for my sons B-day dinner. Forgot to request the bar area since that&#39;s where they have HH. Myself, my 2 teenage sons, and my parents were sat in a booth in main dining. When we asked about HH our server Judith was so kind and polite and tried to find us a table in the bar. We ended up not wanting to wait for a table to open up in the bar area so we stayed in her section. She was wonderful! We never waited for anything! I saw her walk by us repeatedly, but never bothered us. She was just making sure to be around IF we needed her. Always kind. polite, and personable. All of us loved our food. It was a great dining experience for us all. Thanks Judith
The food is good but bit pricey  love the beef fajita and the cheesecake is so bummm  we&#39;ll definitely gonna come back here

Went there for a coworker going away happy hour. There were about 10 in our group and we told our server before we ordered that we would require separate checks. The food came mostly in a timely fashion (one order wasnt brought out until 45 minutes after it was placed). Server didn&#39;t check on us and we frequently had empty glasses. When she did take additional drink orders, they took 10-15 minutes to come. <br><br>The worst part was getting our checks. We asked for our bill at around 6:00. It took over an hour to get our checks. When asked about the unacceptable delay, the manager said that&#39;s what happens when checks need to be broken out and put together differently. This is precisely why I make it a point to state that we would need separate checks before we ordered. There was no offer of compensation. Not even an apology. <br><br>The food and drink isn&#39;t good enough to offset this poor of service. Especially when management doesn&#39;t even realize that there&#39;s a problem. Take your larger parties elsewhere.

Yikes. Not quite sure how to start this review.. So I&#39;ll start from the beginning. We came here on a Sunday, it was actually really quiet - must have been the fabulous 58 degree (heat wave) weather we were experiencing. We were seated quickly at a booth and our drink order was taken quickly. Before long, a party of about 26 people took over the booth behind us and the 2 large tables to the side of us. The adults occupied one table while the kids (probably between 7 and 12) had their own tables. THEY WERE SO LOUD. Not only was I about to break a took after taking a bite of the bread that came with the Crab &amp; Artichoke Dip, I was constantly being annoyed by this group of kids. The parents, of course, all had down 2 beers in the first 10 minutes and couldn&#39;t care less about what the kids were doing. I asked if we could be moved and we were told that once we place an order, we can&#39;t be moved. In my many years of dining, I&#39;ve never heard that before. So we stuck it out. The food was less than delicious. I was actually quite disappointed. Their Passion Fruit Margarita actually wasn&#39;t awful. But with the dining experience I had, I probably need a minimum of 10 of those to cope with the irritation. Most likely would not return.

So, the last time I was here was probably 10 years (or more) ago. I have not been back since as back then the food was cafeteria like and definitely not worth the money...<br><br>HOWEVER... that is definitely NOT the case now. <br><br>For Christmas I was given some gift cards for free slices of cheesecake so we decided to head on over and check the place out. On walking in I noticed that the place looks like it sits the day it was built, which I find impressive knowing the kind of wear and tear a restaurant goes through. We were seated right away at a booth in the bar area right next to a server station. It was an out of the way spot that wasn&#39;t very comfortable, the servers would frequently congregate there and talk and laugh loudly, it was very distracting. <br><br>It took about 10 minutes for someone to come to our table for the drink order. On happily noticing that they have a happy hour I chose one of the drinks, the JW berry lemonade or something like that. It was good but you really didnt notice any alcohol and for the size that thing was I should have been calling an uber home!<br><br>My friend ordered the happy hour burger and happy hour crispy chicken sliders and both were actually REALLY good!! I ordered the carbonara and I was more than pleasantly surprised!<br><br>For my free cheesecake I got the coffee cream one and it is to die for!<br><br>I&#39;m pretty sure we&#39;ve decided to come back another time and check out a bit more of their happy hour menu!

Love love the food here! Large selection of cheesecakes which are always tasty!<br><br>Delicious Fettuccine Alfredo that is super creamy and thick. Their avocado egg rolls are great as well. My boyfriend has tried their meatloaf which was just okay and he also tried their Spicy Shanghai noodles and thought it was tasty, just not spicy. <br><br>They have a hugee variety of food which comes with pros and cons. Pros are you can get whatever your heart desires. Cons are with that amount of variety, their food can be hit or miss at times. A few times I&#39;ve had chunky, uncooked noodles with my Alfredo, and my boyfriend&#39;s meatloaf would occasionally be dried out. <br><br>Overall, this place is pretty good. The cramped atmosphere and high prices would be the biggest downside.

The lemonades the offer were pretty tasty. Strawberry was good. I ordered the friend shrimp appetizer, and it was not my favorite. Shrimp just kind of seemed like the end of the bag. But I loved the cashew chicken, and the pot stickers were good.

Went in on 6/27/20.  Server wore gloves.  I didn&#39;t see him change gloves between picking up dirty dishes at one table and delivering fresh food at another table. Also he didn&#39;t bring me a new glass with refill, he took dirty glass to refill. Never had a restaurant do that with Covid restrictions. Doesn&#39;t that create germs on the gloves and cross contamination? Make sure only bus people clean tables.  Just doesn&#39;t make sense to do any of that during Covid.  Retrain staff.  Won&#39;t be back and I&#39;m a regular.

I love the Cheesecake Factory!!!<br><br>The seating is a little cramped &amp; during rushes it&#39;s very loud!!<br><br>I personally love how big the menu is &amp; how much they have to offer. I usually try to get a different entree every time I go. I usually like everything I order. One of my favorite things on the menu is the chicken potstickers! So good! <br><br>The cheesecake is amazing! I especially love the celebration cheesecake!<br><br>I understand they are the busiest during the weekend but I wish they took reservations! I&#39;ve been invited to celebrate bdays here, show up &amp; it&#39;s a 2 hour wait sometimes. <br><br>The staff all around are usually really nice &amp; professional! It&#39;s fancy enough to where they will box your food. <br><br>They have a pretty decent happy hour in the bar area.

I ordered take out. For take out orders you go to the bakery counter. I did have to wait a few extra minutes for my order which was fine. It was a bit crowded around the bakery as people were looking at the cases, picking up takeout, and waiting for their takeout. Inside seemed very clean. The food was great. I would recommend the California Guacamole Salad. I tried a cheesecake and the bottom was a little too hard for my liking as it was a bit heavy on the caramel and nuts. I would not have that kind again but would try something else if I ordered again. All the staff I met were very polite.

Came to relax and eat with my daughter... received a very unrelaxing experience at the bar. While it was a very busy Sunday, only one bartender attending the bar. It seemed that every item was imputed in to be ordered. Was frustrated by the time I was ready to go. <br>My food came out from kitchen in &#34;pieces&#34;- one by one! <br><br>Cheesecake we ordered came out wrong, my bread sis not come with my order- no butter or utensils. <br><br>This used to be a place that you could not wait to eat- gone downhill as attentiveness to details had gone down hill. <br><br>Still time to resurrect this place of the key people are hired. <br><br>Bleh

I love my local Cheesecake Factory, but sadly, this place doesn&#39;t care about take out/Door dash orders? I&#39;ve been traveling here for last 4 weeks, I tried multiple times to give them a chance to do it right. Consistently had orders that were made wrong. Not sure what the point of putting preferences in order if no one is going to actually read &amp; follow the customers preferences? Very disappointed with this location.

Server gave me wrong martini, a watered down lemon martini &amp; did not acknowledge it said I ordered it then I ask her to check her clipboard &amp; she then says &#34;oh you ordered a dirty martini&#34;. Yes I did you liar that would not apologize! Then charged me both the crappy lemon martini that came in a small champagne flute when I ordered a dirty martini I expect a martini glass! Mngr comes says too bad you drank it so we are still charging &#34;WE ARE CORPORATE&#34;. Your CEO is going to hear from me. LOL. I hope you two lose your jobs. VERY BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!

My gf and I ate here for lunch on 6/16/19. We were seated very quickly and our waitress was very friendly. We started with the Mac N Cheese bites for our appetizer. My gf and I were impressed by how delicious this entree was. We than ordered our main course which my gf has gotten the open faced chicken parmesan pizza looking dish with which the chicken acted as the dough for a pizza flattened out and rounded. She said it was very good they definently give you enough quantity to be able to make 2 or 3 meals out of there entrees. I had the fettucini alfredo plain pasta. Pretty much fell to my top 5 favorite alfredo dishes I have ordered and have eaten at previous restaurants. Overall we loved the ambiance here at the Cheescake factory and will be visiting again in our near future. If you are near the southdale center feel free to swing by and try this place out for yourselves everyone has different experiences so you&#39;re may be better or worse.

Wasn&#39;t impressed with my visit on Sunday evening. After being seated it took our server only 10 minutes to even stop by the table. Had to flag him down to get refills on drinks an the food was sub par at best. The Chicken alfredo sauce tastes a little strange. I&#39;m wondering if it&#39;s even true alfredo or just a cheese sauce.

I&#39;m on a mission to find the best happy hour! My friend and I went to the Cheesecake Factory for happy hour after work on a Thursday. We sat at a high top table in the bar area. The server was very friendly and attentive. I ordered a skinny mojito to drink. (I love how Cheesecake Factory offers many low calorie options!) You can still have yummy things and not worry about all the calories. To eat I had the spinach and artichoke dip with chips. This was yummmmmmy goodness! Obvi not a low calorie option but the skinny mojito balanced it out . My friend had the fried zucchini which was accompanied by ranch dressing. She also enjoyed her app. I loved the various drink and food options on the happy hour menu. I will definitely keep CF on my go-to list for happy hour!

Reviewing for my wife. Bad experience today. They brought the wrong order for my daughter. She ordered chicken pot pie and got pasta. She had to wait until everyone else had finished before she got her lunch. Waiters unapologetic. Manager brought the right dish - no apology. No adjustment to the bill even though she didn&#39;t have time to eat it all. I wouldn&#39;t bother to write the review but we had the same experience last time, about three weeks ago. What is wrong with this place?  Used to be great. I can understand the mistake, but the lack of apology or even showing they care?  Will steer clear until they at least get back to 4 stars.

I didn&#39;t have high expectations coming in but I was shocked by how beautiful it was inside. The staff is very nice but the food takes its time. The music inside is very loud and a little obnoxious. Otherwise this is a very nice restaurant.

Again top notch food from a wonderful restaurant! Truthfully their menu is so effin large that there really is something for everyone ! Staff is friendly and knowledgeable - love that ! Food is delicious as always ( this time I have the turkey avocado sandwich ... however I noticed this time that they do t ha e WiFi?!?!? WHAT IS UP WITH THAT? It must be an oversight because management can&#39;t possibly be that cheap to not have WiFi for their guests ... Anyway I still love this place and simply used my phone as a hotspot #batterylife

I went to this location of the Cheesecake Factory with a number of coworkers for a farewell happy hour. It was the worst service I have ever received in my life. Food was forgotten, when it did arrive, it was mediocre at best. It took the waitress 45 minutes to get our bills complete &amp; distributed to us after we had requested them, and getting refills or new drinks required us to go up to the bar because we couldn&#39;t get them from her. I will not be back.
Unbelievably slow and unorganized for takeout. Left without even picking my order up because it was so disorganized

I&#39;ve been back to the cheesecake factory and not all of the restaurant is bad it&#39;s particularly the wait staff at the to go counter it causes issues a few staff members don&#39;t seem to be well placed in their roles they seemed frustrated bitter rude and disgruntled and they take it out on the customers.

I come to this Cheesecake Factory a lot and the service workers specifically the servers are really horrible. I have spoken to managers many times at this location to ask if they would train their servers better. I totally understand if the restaurant is busy and it takes a long time for them to get back to us but when they have like 2 or 3 tables in my seating area they avoid interactions with my table. They continuously bring our cold or burnt foods and when you complain one server had the audacity to say &#34;there&#39;s no way your food could be cold&#34; and &#34;what do you want me to do&#34;. That&#39;s not acceptable behavior that&#39;s actually so disrespectful. I&#39;m a person of color so service people give me a hard time everywhere I go, getting great service is a once in a lifetime thing for people like me. I usually allow it but this Cheesecake Factory is the worst service ever consistently how is that even possible. It&#39;s like they&#39;re being trained to be rude and unhelpful towards the huge Somali community that come to this location. The management seems really nice and helpful, the bussers are really great, but the servers need some training because they&#39;re unconscious biases are constantly on display. I do not see myself coming back to this location ever again. I hope they read this review and have a conversation or even a diversity training.

what can i say that&#39;s negative about this place? from the slightly upscale feel that&#39;s offered to suburbians to the scrumptious food, its a midwestern slice of heaven!<br><br>i&#39;ve been here on a lot of occasions ranging from birthday dinners to take outs to cheat meal splurges, and i&#39;ve never had a bad experience. The staff are very professional, warm, and friendly. If there is a problem, they rectify it immediately in my experience. They treat everyone fairly and with respect. <br><br>The actual ambience of the place ranges from casual date night to formal dinners, but for the most part it is a dress up, wear your heels kinda place. If you come in around dinnertime, be prepared to wait for at least 35mins, more on weekends. But you can casually browse southdale-the beepers work within 100ft. if you order take out, it&#39;ll take at least 30mins but you can park in the designated parking near the front and go to the bakery straightway. that&#39;s where the take out/grubhub orders are picked up from<br><br>I&#39;ve tried a lot of dishes and im just going to list my favorites here:<br>mashed potatoes-creamy,perfect blend of herbs, smooth and comforting<br>crispy fried cheese-the fontina in this is whats giving it the kick!<br>avocado egg rolls-smooth,yummy and when dipped with the green sauce, insatiable!<br>chicken madeira-although their signature dish,its a little overrated<br>chicken costoletta-crispy with just the right amount of lemon<br>chicken alfredo-good but can get overwhelming<br>cheesecake-divine! each one is unique so try them all, my fav is the mango key lime cheesecake. its coconut/mango/key lime flavor is unmatchable and a flavor that needs to be tried at least once before one dies

Food was awful and ridiculously over priced. Was told that the patio was closed for seating and then ten minutes later noticed that they were seating it. The only good thing about this place is the free bread they serve.

This is my spot. I love this place. Even when they piss me off they are great. I like to think my order I&#39;d easy but it&#39;s wrong most times I get it. But damn the food is so good. <br><br>However I hate when I order my food for pick up and get there and still ha e to wait 20 minutes for my food. As if they don&#39;t cook it until you get there. What&#39;s the point of giving me a time frame on the phone if you&#39;re going to do that.... <br><br>Nonetheless....I love their chicken strips. <br>They are a scratch kitchen. <br>The blue cheese is chunky.<br>Honey mustard is made daily.<br>Along with the other dressings.

Wow is this place busy. Here on a Thursday afternoon and the wait was 30-40 minutes m. Having only came here for cheesecake, we opted for the to go option.<br><br>I haven&#39;t been to a cheesecake recently but I was impressed by their selection! From classic flavors to decadent chocolate creations of art, this is one of the best ways to consume 1200 calories.<br><br>Come for the cake, but expect to wait!

I have been to The Cheesecake Factory on many occasions. There are good things about it and some bad things about it.<br><br>One of the good things is that the restaurant itself is very cool and nice inside. It can get a little dark inside after sunset, but overall it is clean and a cool environment.<br><br>One of the bad things is that the food isn&#39;t super super great. It is good and is okay, but not worth the prices you are paying here. Some of the appetizers aren&#39;t that bad like the stuffed mushrooms.<br><br>You don&#39;t come here for the meal though. You come for the dessert! This is honestly the best thing about the restaurant. The chocolate Godiva cheesecake is very good, but my personal favorite is the Linda&#39;s Fudge Cake! It is very moist and rich. Definitely something you should share with a friend!<br><br>Overall, fun environment, decent food, good dessert!

So disappointed with my visit there. I wanted to take my baby sister and cousin out for a nice dinner but even they weren&#39;t pleased. We waited so long for the food to come and our waitress even came and said she wasn&#39;t sure why it was taking so long. When the order arrived, my fries were stale and sisters tacos were soggy. The waitress herself was a sweetheart but otherwise we weren&#39;t too happy.

For a party of 12, we already knew that the wait would be longer than usual. However when we called in before, they told us it would be only 1 hour wait. When we got there, they also told us it would be about 60-70 minutes wait, which is fine. Then after that wait, they kept telling us 20 minutes after 20 minutes, which then became a 3 hour wait.<br><br>If you have a huge party that is better than 4 four, I would suggest a different place.<br>The service was also poor.

Bad for families with small kids<br>Once again, we came to this place unable to make a reservation and were told we had a 20 minute wait. After 20 minutes we still had a 20 minute wait. The place is loud, and filled with families with grumpy kids like ours. This is because they&#39;re all made to wait.  So, what initially sounded like a fun idea ended in frustration.<br>Since this was the 3rd time the server had lied to us in three visits, we just left. The food is not worth it. Most of it has way too many calories, the taste is standard, and now the cheesecake is very overpriced at 8 to 9 dollars a slice.<br>Maybe if they start taking reservations, stop lying to us at the server kiosk, and reduce a few of their prices to that of the quality of the food, we will come back.<br>Until then, go to Peoples Organic across the street. There&#39;s no wait, the food is more nutritious, and the prices are reasonable.

This restaurant can turn out good food, but be wary if you order from them via a delivery service. After the food is in your home, you can&#39;t send it back to the kitchen. <br><br>Among the sadnesses we&#39;ve received from them are eggs overcooked and burnt, toast done on one side and plain white bread on the other, lasagna constructed from glued-together layers of undercooked pasta with nothing in-between, pasta dishes and salads missing main ingredients, and so on. Other food items arrive complete and delicious, but it&#39;s often a coin-flip on what&#39;s in the bag.

Stopped in for lunch while we had a break from the hospital service was good my first time here I like that the menu has a breakdown of calorie content as I do watch what I eat menu has almost too many options I ordered the lettuce wraps Asian style was delicious ordered a mojito that was perfect our party of 3 agreed that the food was very good nice portions

Overrated! Waited so long for my food to come out. <br>I had the steak Diane and shrimp scampi. I asked for medium rare, the steak was over cooked and dry! They gave me 3 shrimp (not worth my 22 bucks for that small portion). <br><br>The calamari was soggy! No crunch at all. <br><br>I also order the pork belly sliders. The flavors was good but the pork was super dry. <br><br>Overall I had a bad experience.

Ordered cheesecake online and went inside to wait for it.  Line around the corner inside and absolute chaos.  Manager is dipping strawberries leisurely instead of helping the guys behind the counter.  Very sad sight.

A 3 hr wait was ridiculous. We called and was advised 1 hr wait time, and by the time we got there we got on the waitlist and it was for 70-80 minutes wait, which it was fine. We were a little bit larger party so we knew we had to wait, but they kept telling us 20 mins after 20mins, and then another 20 mins. It was almost 3 hrs by the time we got the tables. The waiter was fabulous but unfortunately the restaurant did not even bother to compensate for the time we waited. If they were upfront on the wait time, it would be fine. But they were not. Who wants to wait that long for their birthday dinner? Oh, on top of that, you get only a tiny scoop of sundae for you birthday. <br><br>It&#39;s not that special. Don&#39;t come here to celebrate. Dont come here if you have more than 4 people unless you want to wait for 3 hrs or come here after 10pm so you dont have to wait.

Leaving the famous Cheesecake Factory a 4, ONLY because I go often and usually have a great experience there. Though in my last visit, I would&#39;ve ranked it a solid 2.5, and that kills me &#39;cause I love CF.<br><br>Went last night for the boo thang&#39;s early birthday dinner. The breakdown of last night&#39;s shenanigans:<br><br>Drinks:<br>- Asian Pear Martini: Yuuum! This more so felt like a dessert than anything. It was sweet, smooth, &amp; delicious. Only complaint is that it felt like there was barely any alcohol in it (granted it&#39;s supposed to be a sweet drink). If you&#39;re looking for something boozy like me, this might not be the drink for you.<br><br>Apps:<br>- THEIR BROWN STARTER BREAD: That sweet, delectable, soft, brown goodness that they serve before every meal. Just... wow. I think I more so come just for that than anything else really. If I could start my days with that bread, I couldn&#39;t pasta-bly (ha) ask for more.<br><br>- Vietnamese Shrimp Summer Rolls: probably should&#39;ve expected this &#39;cause... I mean... it&#39;s a pasta restaurant... but the their take on Vietnamese spring rolls were a huge no-go for us. We were pretty sure they pre-made it and left them in the coolers all day. Wasn&#39;t fresh AT ALL.<br><br>Entrees:<br>- Farfalle w/ Shrimp &amp; Roasted Garlic Pasta: Now THIS was bomb. You&#39;d have to order it to see what I&#39;m talking about. Normally comes with chicken, but I switched and paid the upgrade for shrimp. Only complaint is again- last night being the weird variable- I was pretty sure they forgot about us &#39;cause the food took way too long to come out, and it also came out barely warm. Normally a great meal though and still highly recommend.<br><br>- Jamaican Black Pepper Shrimp: the boo somewhat liked it. Huge portions which was a plus and had a colorful variety on the plate. First time ordering it so perhaps if it came out hotter, we might&#39;ve enjoyed it more.<br><br>Overall- though last night&#39;s experience was off, in general, they&#39;re a great place to eat. Didn&#39;t get a chance to eat their cheesecake last night, but note that it&#39;s one of the best!

Second time we have driven 25 minutes away to come here and both times there is over an hour wait. It is absolutely RIDICULOUS how they don&#39;t accept reservations. You are just being disgusting humans because clearly you&#39;re only after the money. 1 star.

My wife and I experienced friendly and helpful but incredibly slow service  during lunch today.  We were seated at approximately 12:15 and didn&#39;t receive our food until a bit around 1:15 despite the restaurant only being 20% full.  The server explained that the greeters had forgotten to inform her that we had been seated.  <br><br>We noticed that the prices on the food we ordered had significantly increased as well vs. our prior visit.  With the price gap between CF and Cov shrinking, we will likely head there for our next weekday lunch.

We haven&#39;t been here for a while so decided to try it again.<br>Pros:<br>Friendly host <br>Seated with minimal wait <br>Great Caesar salad<br>Great manager<br><br>Cons:<br>Waitress-rude <br>Waited 40 minutes for 3 entrees with no explanation or apologies <br>All food arrived either lukewarm or cold so not  worth the wait. <br><br>We sent the food back and asked for the check. Spoke with the manger and explained our frustration with food and service. He was sympathetic and handled it very well.  Waitress dropped the check off without saying anything. <br><br>Last time for us at the Cheesecake Factory.

Great service by Nick on my adult daughters birthday.  The dark bread was fabulous and they gladly brought another.  Drink prices are high. <br><br>We were able to be seated within 10 minutes on a Tuesday in the summer.  <br><br>Craft beer menu was IPA heavy so I passed, as I am a pale ale and dark beer fan.
I am sitting here waiting for a to go order that was supposed to be ready over 25 minutes ago. Their food is good but count on a ridiculous wait if you order to go.

The 1 star is only for the delicious cheesecake we had. <br><br>We arrived at 9:00pm for dessert so that we could bypass the crazy dinner rush yet it still took us 15 minutes to get greeted, and that&#39;s after going up to the host stand to tell the host, and then another 15 minutes to get the only food item we ordered which was 1 slice of cheesecake. Not to mention, the extra 5 minutes, after we got the cheesecake mind you, for our 2 cocktails. <br><br>Save your sanity and money on this overpriced &#34;restaurant&#34; and venture somewhere else.

This place used to be so great but it&#39;s just not anymore. I ate there recently and found a plastic bread twistie in my pasta. Yes, they took it off the tab but hat was it! Then the server was crabby and acted like it was my fault! I should have known when there was no line like there used to be.

My wife and I are regulars at this Cheesecake Factory location. Every time we go, we get super fast and professional service. It&#39;s a super popular restaurant so don&#39;t be surprised if you have to wait for awhile to be seated. To us, it&#39;s worth the wait since we like it so much. Lots of people complain about the lengthy menu, but in my eyes it&#39;s convenient that they have options for just about everyone, from meat lovers to vegans. Prices are pretty typical for a place like this. Steak and fish will be more just like any other place. If the two of us go and do not get drinks, the bill is usually between 30 and 40 dollars. Cheesecake and alcohol will raise your bill very quickly. <br><br>We&#39;ve had one server twice gave us a bit of a sour taste. She didn&#39;t get our order right both times, and she was a bit rude. Otherwise the rest of the staff is wonderful!

worst customer service ive experienced from a restaurant. we walked in and the welcoming girl didn&#39;t say a word just stared at us.. I told her  for two she grabbed two menus then just walked off to  a table never saying a word. Once our food finally arrived we were never checked  on I had to ask a different server for what I needed... our waitress just stood in the  corner with another waitress joking around. If we new it was good places walking distance we wouldn&#39;t went there the service was so bad....

First of all, their crab bites are drool worthy with the perfect crisp on the outside and fluffiness of crab for the inside. Their malts or cream in their ice cream as well as the cream in their cheese food items has a delicious creamy aspect about it too that&#39;s very high quality. Last night I went and ordered a skinny artichoke appetizer... because they only had one slice instead of two, they just simply gave the one slice to me for free and even apologized to me about it. Are you kidding me? What an awesome tasty gift that was for me! : ) That was, seriously, a very sweet gesture to do, so I really do thank them for doing that for me. Really great quality food and always a treat. A tad loud but that&#39;s understandable considering their popularity. Tis well worth it. : )

Do not order the cheese steak. This place is overrated in the first place and the cheese steak is very over hyped. It is extremely dry, the bread was tough and hard to chew and the seasoning on the steak is mediocre. The cheese is also almost non existent. Do yourself a favor and get something else

I was a party of 4... the server started out strong but became absent when i asked her if she could do anything about a screaming child behind me ( btw the child had been screaming for 10+ mins).<br>My food came out Luke warm, my bf came out half done, my brothers bun to his burger came out soggy.  She came back and my bf told about his meal.  The cooks literally threw it in a hot pan, evaporated the cream sauce and gave it back.  Horrible food-- <br>Took a piece of cheesecake home and ate it 2 hours later - still frozen--- wtf <br>I will never go back to this location again !!

Damn! Last time I tried this place was years ago and it has gone from bad to worst. What is the deal with the eardrum shattering loud, annoying music?  It is not possible to have a conversation or even think! Hey Cheesecake Factory this is not a disco! I used to mildly accepted this place now I just hate it.

Came here for the sangria.<br>It was some of the best Sangria I&#39;ve had in the Twin Cities metro area. Some of what we ordered didn&#39;t come with our food and the server took a while to check after the food was delivered. But other than that we had a pretty good experience.

We just completed a very enjoyable meal!  There was a minor hiccup in the kitchen on one of our orders, but the situation was dealt with quickly and professionally.  Our server, Bridgette has mastered her craft! She was pleasant, prompt and professional throughout our visit.  We appreciate the delicious gluten free pasta options for our two celiacs in the family, and the other dishes were solid as well!<br><br>One minor suggestion: if you&#39;re going to serve Asian style dishes like spicy cashew chicken, have chopsticks available (they&#39;re cheap ). Thanks for a great meal!

Sooo good! Even the bread that we started was good, crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside, warm too! The cheeseburger spring rolls was the best part. The shell was super thin and crunchy, dipping sauce really complemented the taste. The shrimp and steak combo entree was worth it as well, finished everything to the last bite. The cheesecake was so so for me because it was a bit too sweet.

This was my first visit to this Cheesecake Factory, my second to any Cheesecake Factory. The food and service were great. I think that their wine is a little over priced but that would be my only complaint. I&#39;m fond of the atmosphere and if course, the deserts. I will definitely be back based on this experience.

Changes:<br><br>The menu could use a total make over , like they say a picture is worth a thousand words, I bet they would sell more dish if they added pictures to their menu.<br><br>Most people are visual when it comes to foods , having a lot of dish with picture would help sell more .<br><br>The good : the seating didn&#39;t take too long, the waiter came around almost right away.<br><br>The bakery at lest have display of what they have to offer .<br><br>Atmosphere is family friendly <br><br>Price is a bit on the middle to high range<br><br>But the portion is good not too small <br><br>BUT the pizza is on the personal size pizza , if you order the slice, it&#39;s very small<br><br>The bad: silverwares are place just on the table , not sure how &#34;clean&#34; these table tops are , but placing in napkins or on the plate would be better then directly on the table .<br><br>It took a long time to get the foods to the table .<br><br>All in all, it&#39;s good if it was something that you had made at home , but since it&#39;s a restaurant .. it leaves you with the feeling , &#34;there&#39;s better stuffs out there &#34;..

It&#39;s always a treat coming here because there is only one location in MN. Not only that but the drive from Arden Hills to Edina isn&#39;t always ideal. <br><br>I love coming here, the brown bread is the BEST with butter .. mmmm .. the white bread is great for dipping in pasta sauce if you choose to order pasta. <br><br>Every time I come here I order the same dish and cheesecake. Spicy Chipotle Chicken Pasta --extra spicy. IT IS SOOOO GOOD, even if you don&#39;t get it extra spicy it is still spicy. I love the sauce, the chicken is always cooked perfectly, the noodles .. goodness I never loved penne noodles so much. <br><br>I always get the Chocolate Tuxedo Cheesecake, it is so delicious and rich with chocolate. I used to always get the German Cheesecake but they no longer have that .. they actually haven&#39;t had that for years. <br><br>I have had their lettuce wraps, they are tasty. They egg rolls ... pretty dang good, their mushrooms ..mmmmmmmm yum, calamari is always good. Those appetizers are pretty good. <br><br>Their fries are good, chicken bang, bang, is delicious, fish and chips are good and crispy, their Diana steak is DELICIOUS too. They have good food but i prefer their pasta.

The impulse to look upon chain restaurants with disdain is understandable. Too often they tend to live down to already modest expectations. That said, on the multiple occasions I&#39;ve enjoyed lunch or dinner at the Cheesecake Factory, I find them a cut above average.<br><br>Ordinarily a menu as voluminous as the one offered by CF would be a bright red flag. No place can be all things to all people. Right? While this may hold true in general, and while CF may have an occasional miss, I&#39;ve found the majority of items that I&#39;ve tried to be hits. I particularly like the Chicken Piccata (I substitute mashed potatoes for the angel hair pasta). It probably has more sodium than a family of five needs in a week. But it&#39;s rich, savory and chock full of mushrooms and capers. It invariably makes for two meals since I end up taking about half of the serving home with me.<br><br>The other day I ate here with my daughter before a visit to the Apple Store (my next review). She ordered the Vegan Cobb Salad described as &#34;Crisp Lettuce Topped with Grilled Asparagus, Green Beans, Roasted Beets, Avocado, Cucumber, Tomato, Garbanzo Beans, Quinoa, Almonds and Sunflower Seeds with House Vinaigrette.&#34; It was bright, crisp and filled with fresh veggie goodness. She can be quite critical of commercial salads but pronounced this a winner. She added to it an order of falafel. We both found them to be appealingly crunchy on the outside, moist and flavorful on the inside.<br><br>I&#39;ve never experienced anything other than cordial and professional service. Iced Tea and water are promptly refilled without asking. Food arrives in a reasonable time frame and is typically at the proper temp. There have been some longer wait times for a table but nothing too onerous. Most recently (on a Tuesday evening) we were seated immediately.<br><br>This is not a hipster, foodie destination. Nor does it aspire to be such. It really is one of those relatively rare destinations where in my experience everyone should be able to find something much to his or her liking.<br><br>Finally, of course the cheesecake is very good. I especially like the Dulce de Leche Caramel and the White Chocolate Raspberry Truffle. I also enjoy a very occasional slice of the Chocolate Tower Truffle cake. Extremely indulgent? Yep! Excessively caloric? You betcha! Completely over the top? No doubt. But I rationalize the dessert overload by noshing on it for a few days, pulling a huge slice out of the frig for a few bites at a time.

I love the decor! It is stunning. It kind of reminds me of the mall in Las Vegas with the painted sky ceiling and the dim lights. <br><br>Happy hour drinks:<br><br>J.w.&#39;s pink lemonade: Skyy Citrus vodka, raspberry licqeur and lemonade $5.50 - tasted like watered down lemonade but maybe it&#39;s a good thing it didn&#39;t taste strong. This is a popular drink that many people enjoy.<br><br>Margarita: Classic margarita with gold tequila, triple sec and fresh lime $5.50 - this was strong but not too bad!<br><br>Happy hour appetizers: <br><br>Soy glazed edamame $4.95 - I&#39;m not sure why they give you the option of having it plain or with soy sauce. Most restaurants offer edamame with soy sauce on the side. I wish that was the case here but it was good. If I had to order it again, I would take it plain.<br><br>Portobello mushroom avocado and zucchini fries $6.95 - I liked the texture of it except the fried avocado was not my favorite. I think it was too soft for my preference but the batter was fried perfectly and it tasted very crisp. <br><br>Entree: <br><br>Miso salmon about $19 - delicious! I only ate half of it and saved the rest for lunch tomorrow. The sauce it as glazed in was sweet. This meal came with a few vegetable peas but I wish it came with broccoli or more. It comes with white or brown rice. I&#39;d recommend this dish at least once to try.  <br><br>Dessert: <br><br>Lemon raspberry cream cheesecake - hands down light, fluffy, smooth, and all worth it! I&#39;m so glad I tried this and I would get it again. It was mostly cheesecake with a lemon cake type of crust.. At least that&#39;s what I think I tasted :)<br><br>Waitress:<br><br>Tara - hands down the best service I&#39;ve had in a long time. She checked my birth date on my ID and noticed that my birthday was a couple days ago. So she gave me the cheesecake with happy birthday decorations on it. She recommended everything that I ordered, and she checked up on my table every once in a while. If you get her as a waitress, you will enjoy your dining experience!

Pretty happy with our experience. I came in with a poor attitude yet we both enjoyed our lunches off the Skinnyliscious menu. I had a turkey burger and salad and my wife had the lettuce wrap tacos. They were both pretty good. Service was excellent. We will come back, had not been there for years. We were there about 2pm on Sunday.

The food was really quite good. I&#39;ve been a few times and never have been disappointed. Last time was more than five years ago. I usually think of Cheesecake Factory as feeling overstuffed by the end of the night, but they&#39;ve really developed a nice skinny menu. Both my wife and I ordered off it and the meals were very tasty and satisfying. I had lemon garlic shrimp and she had the chicken salad. My boys ordered off the regular menu with steak medallions and chicken tacos and they were well seasoned and tasty. The Oreo and Godiva cheesecakes were of course rich and decadent. The waitress appeared fairly new and apologized a few times, thanking us for our patience. This surprised as she was rather quite attentive and available when we needed her. Only complaints would be the warmer-than-room-temp red wine and greasy-feeling menus.

Third visit there and I don&#39;t think I&#39;ll be going back for sure after this experience. Went in on valentines day (no RSVP allowed for that day) and had a wait of roughly an hour, just to be seated (not a big problem given the circumstance of the event). Took about another half hour to recieved food (again, understanding the current situation). While waiting, the waitress to the table next to ours (not our waitress) had accidentally knocked over that tables water and had gotten water all over them and us, but she seem to be a bit oblivious about it getting on us since we weren&#39;t her table. Yes, I understand its just water, no big deal, but I think an apology would suffice and would&#39;ve been appropriate. What else was disappointing was that I ordered the chicken Bellagio and had received a plate of undercooked spaghetti noodles which then took at least 10 minutes to flag down our waitress to get a new plate. Estimated time spent there would be about 2 hours and didn&#39;t even get the chance to eat because I just asked them to make the new one to go, since I&#39;ve already been a bit irritated of the night.<br><br>Overall, food for price is a good 50/50 ratio. And of course given the name, the Cheesecakes are melt-in-your-mouth worth it. Dine in on a regular day, or don&#39;t bother dining in at all.

Been to plenty of Cheesecake Factory&#39;s before, was disappointed in this one. It was a busy weekend lunch, as usual. They don&#39;t have a good vegetarian/vegan selection, even with this extensive menu. Whatever we did ask for, they were already out of! Baked artichoke, spaghetti, etc you get the picture. I ordered an vegetarian pasta recommended by our waitress, it was super chewy and not edible. They were gracious enough to take it off the bill. The fried Mac n cheese balls are delicious but super unhealthy. We got a couple of cheesecakes to go and those were ok. Red velvet cheesecake is overrated. All in all, I wouldn&#39;t come back.

I love the vibe of this place next to Southdale mall. Starting 4:45pm it starts to get busier and you have to expect a short wait depending on the number of people in your party. I love taking a couple of appetizers to get very different flavors going. The avocado eggrolls and also the chicken pot stickers are something that you would want to try if you haven&#39;t already done so. They are great! Today I had the Asian lettuce wraps and they are a great dish if you&#39;re not craving too many calories and still get a great tasty dish. Both the tamarind sauce as well as the soy-ginger sesame sauce are awesome. All the cheesecake desserts... Say no more and just come with a good and healthy appetite!

I took two sixth grade girls here to celebrate spring break. We had lunch sized portions of fish and chips, herb salmon, and they had cheesecake. Last time I liked my meal better, it was an almond crusted salmon on a bed of kale and it was all chopped up and really delicious. This time the salmon was OK and it was even what he recommended as the most popular salmon. The girls seem to like their meal, but for $65 before tip and us all having water to drink, it was pricy for just being average meal.

I&#39;ve been here several times and I&#39;m just getting around to writing a review. <br><br>As usual they were pretty busy and waiting on a table for three was going to be a while.  Luckily we spotted a table in the bar area which was vacant and made a mad dash to it as it&#39;s first come first serve. <br><br>The menu includes tons of choices for starters, salads, small plates, entrees, sandwiches, etc. It&#39;s actually too much (for me) and a bit bit overwhelming.  Therefore I tend to stick with the massive burrito big enough to feed four.  <br><br>This time I ventured out and went for:<br><br>- Buffalo Wings:  Delicious!  They&#39;re breaded, not super saucy or extra dry, and have the right amount of spice.  Therefore no need to worry about your mouth burning. <br><br>-Beet Salad: I loved it. Includes apples, goat cheese, pecans and arugala dressed with balsamic vinaigrette. It&#39;s on the &#34;skinny&#34; menu for those to eat a &#34;healthier&#34; at Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>I didn&#39;t go for the Strawberry Lemonade which is so good, but hopefully next time.

One of the greats when it comes to chains. All Cheesecake Factories deliver consistently on service and food. There always seems to be a wait for this place, but unlike in SF, the wait is generally around 30 minutes to an hour. Ambience is the same as any other Cheesecake Factory, strangely pleasing despite being a chain, they&#39;ve really got the design and experience down pat! <br><br>We got the grilled salmon (comes with mashed potatoes and broccoli) and the chicken bellagio (lightly crisped chicken breast on top of pesto spaghetti, prosciutto, and arugula). I&#39;ve never been let down with any of the dishes I&#39;ve had here, their pastas are always delicious (if you&#39;re not expecting hand made pasta), their avocado egg rolls are amazing. I&#39;ve never had anything sweet or savory that I regretted here, so it&#39;s a safe choice and a great place if you just want a good, reliable meal without figuring out where to go. <br><br>This is located in the Southdale Mall, so if you don&#39;t want to wait you can try the other restaurants they have in the same mall (PF Chang&#39;s, Rojo&#39;s, an Italian fast food place) or you can go catch a movie @ AMC. There&#39;s always shopping! But remember that their buzzer doesn&#39;t work anywhere outside Cheesecake. <br><br>The only thing they could do a little better is to have a bigger bar area to have a place for people to hang out before they get their tables - it gets way too crowded in there.

The food here is a poor attempt to offer a verity of food.<br>I order the Cajun jambalaya pasta, which was very disappointing. The pasta it self was not cooked all the way, and looked like it came in a package of $1 ramen noodles. There was almost no Cajun flavor or really any seasoning to the dish it self. The chicken was very dry, almost as if it had been pre cooked and left under a heat lamp for an hour. The shrimp was also tasteless and rubbery. Their attempt to offer an enormously large menu can must be the reason for the lack of effort on the food.

I have never been disappointed coming here. Their food is stunning, their options are near endless, their staff are ridiculously nice. Wait times during the week are quite short and the weekend wait times are as expected with such a popular place! Definitely will go back!
Love it!! Always a wait , unless you get a bar seat or high top in the bar. Nice patio in the season. Best cheesecake in town ?? Lol

We live hundreds of miles from the Cheesecake Factory so when we&#39;re in the neighboorhood, we stop by!<br><br>We&#39;d had dinner so just stopped by for... you guessed it, dessert! Hubby had White Chocolate Raspberry and I had Oreo. Both were just okay. <br><br>However, we both got a slice to go for the next day&#39;s breakfast. Clearly a vacation move. In any case, I got the Cherry Cheesecake (traditional with cherry topping) and hubby got a chocolate mousse (?). Both were fantastic! I don&#39;t know if they&#39;re just better flavors or if it was being able to eat cheesecake for breakfast in bed with no children clamoring for a bite, but both were A-Mazing!
Great dinner and service! The cheesecake was also phenomenal as always! Yum! The staff was very friendly also
A twist on every day&#39;s comfort food with a blend of classic cafe varieties. <br>The menu has more chicken dishes than there are grains in a silo.

This place continually delivers. Met a friend for lunch on a Friday afternoon. He hasn&#39;t been for an entire meal, just dessert. After perusing the menu he settled on a personal pizza with a good size Caesar salad. He commented that it was quite a hearty portion. I had the lunch size chicken and avocado salad. We washed our lunches down with a few beers and a bloody mary which was subpar. Nothing too special about that bloody mary. Service was great as always. Lunch time conversation, gabbing with my friend in the back booth was a perfect combination of food, great service and fun and we didn&#39;t have to wait to be seated.

Arrived around 5:30pm on a Sunday and had a 30 minute wait prior to being seated.  Our server was attentive and refilled our drinks without being prompted.  Upon ordering our food the server had a whole list of things that they had ran out of - two of which my friend had wanted.  The menu is extensive so finding something else wasn&#39;t a problem.  I ordered the meatloaf which was plentiful and delicious. It almost has a French onion soup flavor. They bag up any leftovers for you.  Of course we had to get a slice of cheesecake to go. Awww lawdy the salted caramel is deeelish!  Considering how big the portions are the prices are reasonable.
Really great Thai lettuce wraps. The best I&#39;ve had and the dipping sauces were excellent.

I felt like I was eating in a Persian or Greek King mansion. The lights were dimmed and I was greeted by the waiter. I ordered some hot water with lemon, given some complimentary bread, and ordered the California guacamole salad ($12.89) for lunch. Usually salads don&#39;t taste good and are bland, but it was super tasty! I felt like I cleansed my body with the salad, felt fresh. The service was great and I will be coming back for lunch. They have pasta, steaks, pizzas, cheesecakes and they can make any drink that you request. I recommend this place to anyone who likes FOOD! I will comeback for a Cheesecake next time :)

Always a great option!! Being honest I don&#39;t go to the Cheesecake Factory for their entrees so I can&#39;t really judge the food. This trip I had the key lime pie cheesecake (one of my favs!) and the raspberry lemon cheesecake (a new pic). I was extremely satisfied with both.

I normally get the herb crusted salmon at the faction Chicago it&#39;s absolutely delicious but here at this location it&#39;s not good at all..... very very bland no season our server Taylor is horrible well not horrible but unprofessional and clueless won&#39;t be returning ever !!!!!

Met some of my coworkers here for my birthday dinner. I called ahead of time to make a reservation and was told they don&#39;t take reservations, it&#39;s just walk ins only. Three of us out of a total of eight arrive first and we&#39;re told we couldn&#39;t be seated until at least half of the party was present.<br>While I understand they have rules, I was absolutely floored because the places was no where near being packed early evening on a Tuesday.<br>Finally we&#39;re seated; we had to close out our bar tabs and have all of the appetizers transferred to the table. <br>The entree that I ordered was good but I had to ask for the sauces that come with it.<br>All and all it was an okay visit.

Quite possibly THE unhealthiest restaurant in America, but man, some of the dishes here are done extremely well, have quality ingredients and are tastefully presented!<br><br>My favorite being the Chicken Bellagio on their Specialties menu. Angel hair, basil pesto sauce, crispy fried chicken breasts and my favorite part, the prosciutto and arugula on top. Wow. <br><br>Their Chipotle Chicken Pasta is also good, and their Avocado Egg Rolls are delicious for an appetizer.  Having a husband who does not eat avocados, they are all mine! Yay.<br><br>Their hamburgers are good, probably similar to what you would find at Applebee&#39;s, not Red Cow. The Mac and Cheese burger is a yummy choice if you are looking for something different. Their French Fries are thick and fresh! Probably some of my favorite restaurant fries ever.<br><br>The bread they serve with the meal is a French baguette and a Wheat Oatmeal loaf. Very good. For dessert I would recommend their Ultimate Red Velvet Cheesecake, Godiva Chocolate, Lemoncello cheesecake and this seasonal one I tried yesterday, the Mango Key Lime Cheesecake. Everything about that last sentence screams incredible and you should try them all if you are a cheesecake lover!<br><br>What this place does best is utterly behemoth portions that last 2-3 days in the fridge and you can get lots of leftover meals from it. Cheesecake included.<br><br>It looks like Vegas inside, with lots of ceiling decorations and painted walls. Reminds me of the Luxor and Caesar&#39;s Palace, very pretty. You will probably need your stretchy pants and a nap when you get home. It&#39;s the only Cheesecake Factory in Minnesota so enjoy in moderation!

I don&#39;t get it!<br><br>This place is not always busy, but always has a excessive wait time. Saturday nights it&#39;s not uncommon to see a wait time of 2 hours. <br><br>The menu is huge. But it is so big that I think it creates the long wait time since you have to go through the book trying to decide what to order. <br><br>Every time I&#39;ve eaten there, I feel like the food is the same as a Applebee&#39;s, but why did I wait so long for it? I just don&#39;t get it! <br><br>Is there a page I&#39;m missing from the menu for delicious awesomeness? Because I feel like I&#39;m missing the reason people wait so long.

Ordered a chopped salad that was supposed to have chicken on it.  Paid $4 for extra chicken.  This is all the chicken it came with.  Can&#39;t imagine how much I would have got if I didn&#39;t pay $4 extra.

I thought the looks was better than the taste. The food was very bland. Pretty but tasteless....the prices weren&#39;t too bad,a lot to choose from all prolly just as tasteless as the angel haired pasta with shrimp that I ordered.

The Cheesecake Factory is a great place to eat.  Nice portions, great food, cool atmosphere.  The decor is fun to look at.  The service is very good and snappy.  The food was simply delicious.  <br><br>The down side of this place is it is the only one in Minnesota and it is in the Southdale Mall in Edina.  It is difficult to find a parking place close to the restaurant so plan on walking.  Ladies don&#39;t wear the uncomfortable fancy shoes that will kill your feet by the time you get there.  The other thing is there is NOT a call ahead or reservation system in place so you have hoards of people crowding the place to wait an hour for a table.  The crowds block the entry, hallways and make this a tough place to go during the prime time eating hours.<br><br>They definitely need more of these around the Twin Cities.  The food service and decor is a draw, but the lack of parking, long waits and crowds are a real turn off.  Try to plan you meal earlier or later than the normal times and it will be a better experience.  I would stay away on Friday and Saturday nights, it is just too crowded, expect a long wait.
We waited an hour and a half. I ordered the spquetie and meatballs. The meat balls were so dry I could not swallow them. Very disappointing
OMG... that&#39;s alot of good food!  It was a great fam outing!

The Cheesecake  Factory | $14 for the calamari. &#39;Twas alright. Little soggy &amp; bland. I had a $25 gift card from my birthday so my meal was free. The factory combo of the rare steak Diane, mashed potatoes &amp; shrimp scampi was $24 I believe. This dish is actually very good. The portion size of the potatoes though, a little overwhelming, makes the presentation of the plating look bulky &amp; unattractive. The steak was cooked perfectly.  for the factory combo &amp;  for the calamari ZERO STARS for service .<br>. .<br>.<br>.<br>Now that we&#39;ve talked about the plating &amp; flavor, let&#39;s talk about service, or lack thereof. Dannica, by far has provided some of the worst service I have ever had. The hostess sat us &amp; we waited maybe 20 minutes or more before we were even greeted. &amp; even after greeting, we didn&#39;t get drinks. The intervals between greeting, taking drinks, apps &amp; communication in general was far too long in between-maybe 20 min each time. Initially the place was packed because lunch rush of course, however, as a server, you should at least greet your table &amp; check up on them. Dannica is forgetful, inattentive &amp; not very personable. .<br>.<br>.<br>We had a little water spill on the floor at the table &amp; my friend cleaned it herself. She told Dannica, &amp; Dannica said she&#39;d be back, &amp; never came back. By now, the place was already settled &amp; almost empty. Will not be going back. #thecheesecakefactory #cheesecake #steakdiane #calamari #ahituna #tartare #thisismyminnesota #minnstagram #foodgasm #capturemn #captureminnesota<br>#goodeats #tryitordiet #minneapoleats #letsfork #forkedup #foodbeforedudes #foodie #foodstagram #foodporn #foodtography #instafood #instaeats #foodblogger #exploremn #exploreminnesota #thisismymn #foodblogger #straightouttaminnesota #minnesotaaf

We stopped in tonight for a single slice of cheesecake; let me tell you, they had a ton of options which well made me indecisive (as a piece of cheesecake is a huge commitment to someone with lactose intolerance). Anyway, I made my decision selecting the lemon raspberry with a raspberry drizzle. Overall, it was delicious had I been able to taste anything other than lemon; it was extremely rich which can be nice, but this was overkill. I could have saved myself the 7.50$ and just squeezed a lemon into my mouth. <br><br>Even with my lactose, I am a sucker for cheesecake and will definitely return; just not for the lemon raspberry.
My family had a lunch today and the veggie burger came with a live crawling bug. Be careful when eating here, I&#39;m definitely not coming back.

I ate st the Cheesecake Factory for the first time since childhood and it was awful. It was very loud and crowded for starters. We waited for a long time. We got some free bread which was yummy. I ordered chicken Alfredo. The noodles were over done. I found a bone or something in the chicken. The waitress  took it to &#39;show the head chef&#39;. I lost interest in my food after the bone. My husband ordered spinach dip. It was good. We both ordered two different cheesecakes. I got a cookie dough one. He got plain. They tasted waxy and fake. We both ate a bite then we were done. The worst part?  The waitress didn&#39;t take off my Alfredo or even offer to. It was $64! And I left hungry. I highly don&#39;t recommend eating at the Cheesecake Factory. Tons of other better places near by.

Yes I am reviewing the Cheesecake Factory which is the chainiest restaurant ever but it has good food. There might be thousands of calories in one single meal but I have yet to order something that turns out to be average. Their happy hour deals are awesome with the app specials so I would highly recommend stopping there between 4-6 on weekdays. <br><br>Here are my go-to items: <br>-Avocado eggrolls (creamy, sweet, salty, rich)<br>-Buffalo blasts (chicken in buffalo sauce wrapped in a wonton wrapper deep fried in batter i.e. a super fatty app but delicious)<br>-Pasta bellagio (angel hair pasta served with pesto cream sauce, fried chicken, and prosciutto served over bed of arugula)<br>-red velvet cheesecake (amazing cake and cheesecake hybrid, not too sweet)<br><br>So just because I am recommending this place, does not mean you should go here every day!!! The portions are huge and the meals are very rich...moderation people!!! Side note, the menu has way too many items on it and sometimes I feel like I am reading a catalog when all I want is a quick bite to eat. I know, #firstworldproblems.

This location is terrible!! The service was terrible! I sat down at the table at 3:55pm then she didn&#39;t even come to get our food order until 4:15pm. I ordered a mojito and coke which they forgot to bring to us. She only remembered when we reminded her. I asked for my child&#39;s food to come out first. When they brought the food over, they had my husband and my food but not my child&#39;s! The waitress went to get my child&#39;s food but that took 10mins. When she came back with it I said to just bring us boxes and checks so that we could leave and that we did not need the food for my child anymore. I wanted to order a slice of cheesecake but refused because of the terrible and slow service. The waitress even said to us, &#34;I&#39;m sorry for the bad experience and I hope the next time you visit us you have a better experience.&#34;  I will never visit this terrible location again and I will also be leaving a bad review on social media, yelp, google and trip advisor to warn others not to visit this location.

Luke was our waiter tonight and he was fantastic!! We ordered drinks, apps, entrees and last but definitely not least cheesecake. <br><br>Wait time was 40 minutes and seemed to move quickly. <br><br>I ordered the avocado egg rolls, chicken Madeira, salted Carmel cheesecake and a Georgia peach. Everything was perfection. I actually split the children Madeira with my friend. <br><br>My mom got meatloaf, crab bites and salted Carmel cheesecake. Said her food was delicious. <br><br>Sister got loaded baked potato bites and apple crisp for dessert. Apply crisp was bigger than each of our plates. <br><br>I only got a picture of the chicken Madeira and one lonely egg roll. <br><br>Cheesecake Factory is always a favorite. Thanks Luke for being so much fun tonight!! Your sense of humor was necessary for the evening!!

I always have my go-to pasta dish when I go here that is consistently good - and that is no doubt thanks to the creamy buttery sauce that comes with it. <br><br>Mom and I went on a Saturday evening, but thanks to our early 5:30 arrival we only had to wait about 15 minutes. <br><br>Our server was a young guy who was very excited about everything. We were both a little irked that neither the drinks nor the cheesecake listed pricing on the menu. Mom was more than a little shocked to find out at the end of the meal that her chinsy watered down sangria was $9.50, especially compared to my $5 Sierra Nevada. When I asked him what the price was, he admitted he didn&#39;t know.<br><br>I wanted my Farfalle pasta with sundried tomatoes, roasted garlic, peas, and pancetta. It is so delicious that I do NOT want to know how many calories I just ingested. <br><br>Mom asked the server for a recommendation and he had raving reviews for the Bang-Bang Chicken and Shrimp dish. When they arrived, hers was a huge mountain of rice surrounded by the meat/shrimp. While the flavor was good (mostly just the coconut), she did note that there was no essence of &#34;bang-bang&#34; to be found. He got very defensive and snapped he never said it was spicy, and that white people don&#39;t understand what spice is. Odd...<br><br>Our food was good, we were full with little leftovers, but somehow two drinks and two meals added up to over $50. He dropped the bill off with three other tables&#39; tabs also in there which was odd. <br><br>While I usually enjoy myself here, I find that the health/quality of the food and beverages just simply do not measure up to what the charge for them.

If I could give this place a zero I would. I am from Chicago so I do frequently visit the Cheesecake Factory and love it. However I do not get the same feeling about the Cheesecake Factory here in Minnesota. Here&#39;s my experience:<br><br>Last night me and some coworkers visited this establishment in edina for a Christmas celebration. Being a Saturday, we knew there would be a wait on getting a table. However, at check in the hostess said it would be an hour wait. So we went over to partake in a drink at the bar while waiting. We saw that the high top tables were available and was told we could eat there and they were open seating. So we took two high top tables and the waitress brought us our menus, water, and bread. 15 mins later she came back and took our orders, I order the Fish and Chips and there was 10 of us. So it took about 30 mins for &#34;our&#34; food to arrive so multiple people brought our food but not our server. Any who after the last waitress showed up with a plate I still was missing my food. Waiting 5 more minutes my food still didn&#39;t arrive and nor did our waitress come to make sure everything was ok. So midway through my party eating my waitress final shows up, which was about 20 mins after the food was served. It was clear that I had an empty place in front of me and I had not received my food but she went to the other side of the table with the people who were eating to ask if they were ok. So I motioned her to ask her where was and asked her where was my food. Her answer, &#34;oh you didn&#39;t receive your food, I don&#39;t know what happened well what did you order I&#39;ll have them remake it for you.&#34; So I said, &#34;remake, what do you mean it was never made, and what do you mean my coworkers were almost done eating.&#34; I proceeded to say just cancel my order because at this rate I cant enjoy my food because my party was done. So as she brought the checks she came to me first and tried to tell me the reason I didn&#39;t get my food was because I sent it back. So I said why would I do that, that makes no sense, then she told me the wrong item I ordered. I was so distraught, I couldn&#39;t eat with my coworkers, I was really hurt and to have my coworkers sharing their meal with me because I was hungry. This is totally un acceptable after being there in total for about an hour and a half I had to go to wendys to get a chicken sandwich because I was hungry. The entire experience was horrible.

Skip the long waits and dinner altogether and head straight to the cheesecake counter and purchase a slice to go. Take said slice of cheesecake home and eat it while in bed watching your favorite show. Had the white chocolate raspberry truffle and it was rich, but good.

This place cannot handle groups. Our group of 10 waited for over 2 hours for our food. Our waiter continually said the wrong things like &#34;It&#39;ll be out in a minute&#34;, &#34;There&#39;s only a few orders ahead of yours&#34;, etc. I saw several people walk in after us and were served their food. We came to celebrate 2 birthdays and everyone started getting agitated over waiting a ridiculous amount of time. We left. We never got our food.

I&#39;ve been to the Cheesecake Factory quite a few times, and the quality of food has always disappointment me.  That isn&#39;t to say the sauces they use to coat all the food in fat, salt, sugar, and other natural flavors it&#39;s fun and mostly tasty, but I just like crisp lettuce, hot fries, al dente pasta, tender chicken, and strong drinks.  Call me a snob?<br><br>On other notes, service tends to be good, parking is Edina, and they don&#39;t let you make reservations in advance.  Boo.

Yesterday we went to have dinner At the Cheesecake. Apparently the kitchen was backed up and added 1 hour to the already long wait to be seated. They got every order wrong. Burned food and had the audacity to serve by 5 yo raw sliders!!! Today she has a terrible stomach ache; praying it&#39;s not food poisoning.

I had an awful experience here. We called ahead for a larger group. They told us no wait. We showed up and the manager Diego acted like we were lying. He told us one hour to an hour and fifteen minutes. When we asked after waiting 1:15 they lied and told us they said 1:45 in the first place. We ended up waiting two and a half hours and left for Snuffys.<br><br>We had 5 kids under 10 years old and feel upset and mistreated.<br><br>This experience was bad enough that I will never go back. Granted I would never have picked this place in the first place. Never trust a restaurant that has a book sized menu with ads in it. :)

Let me just say they have a huge menu with lots of options for any eater. Depending on what you get the food is tasty. The cheesecakes are also good. We got the pork-chop with mashed potatoes and you won&#39;t be disappointed, very flavorful and moist. We also got the vege egg rolls and those are very fresh and food.
