I gave this 3 stars bc of the service we received.  The lady was nice but terrible at managing her tables. We got no silverware so had to eat the porkchop with a spoon for the first bite or two. We didn&#39;t receive our dessert and it was given to a different table. It definitely was not her night.

I&#39;ve been hesitant writing a review of this Cheesecake Factory as the overall experience has been so inconsistent. However, my last experience, made me see life through Gordon Ramsey&#39;s eyes. <br><br>The first thing I will say is that the avocado egg rolls were amazing. So excellent job. Most appetizers I&#39;ve had here have been great. <br><br>Yet, unfortunately the main course was anything but. I&#39;ll keep it short in saying we ordered our daughter buttered noodles, a nice simple meal as long as it doesn&#39;t sit under a heat lamp for too long. By our estimates, the buttered noodles were under a heat lamp for at least 20 minutes. The end result is severally brown, and hard noodles, you can&#39;t put a fork in. I am not joking when I say this. Even the person helping our server looked at the dish when they were putting it on the table, paused before putting it down, looked curiously at the dish and then layed it in front of our 2-year-old. A piping hot plate, and dried food. <br><br>I thought maybe it would have ended there, but by order of enchiladas were dried too, the sauce was entirely baked into the tortilla meaning: no sauce. The beans had a cooked layer of dryness, and the cilantro rice was so baked on the top layer, I could practically remove the entire layer as it&#39;s own cover. I tried one, bite, but it was hard and I couldn&#39;t finish it. <br><br>My son said his spicy chicken sandwich was okay, except that the spice was inconsistent. One part of the chicken had almost no spice and the other was way too hot for him to eat. While this is an opinion of his, I would agree with him that there shouldn&#39;t be so much disparity on a single piece of chicken. <br><br>Our server was friendly when she took our orders, but never brought the bread she said she was going to bring, and only showed up once after we received our order. That was to give us a check. When she asked if I wanted a box for the pasta we didn&#39;t eat, she looked down at the bowl, and said, &#34;Oh. Probably not.&#34;<br><br>I thought about saying something to management, but frankly I&#39;ve had similar experiences, and was just tired of saying anything. <br><br>The cheesecake was of course very good. <br><br>End result of my many experiences here: Appetizers are always amazing, service can be great, or shoddy depending on the server, main entrees are wildly inconsistent. Cheesecake is always very good. <br><br>Overall, the inconsistency is very difficult as I don&#39;t know if I am going to have a nice meal, or a bad experience. I&#39;ve yet to have an overall good experience, but I&#39;m hoping it does happen. I keep rooting for them!

The Cheesecake Factory is one of the few chains I really enjoy. That said, the Southdale Cheesecake Factory is lacking. One problem is simply that this is the only Cheesecake Factory in the state, so the place is always crazy crowded.  You absolutely have to eat here at an off time or you&#39;ll be waiting for an hour.<br><br>The other problem is the service. For the most part, the hostesses and the servers treat their jobs like they work in, well, a factory. They see the customers as products to churn out on the production line as fast as possible before their shifts end. No friendliness or warmth, and they spend as little time at your table as possible, which means that orders get messed up.  Also, one server gave us an extremely nasty look when we ordered a lunch portion to share, even though everyone knows perfectly well that their lunch portions are enough to serve at least two people.  <br><br>As for the insanely sized portions of rich food that everyone complains about, well, I&#39;m not so put off by that. Yes, I realize that this place is almost a satire of American gluttony, but use common sense, people!  There&#39;s no Clean Plates Club at the Cheesecake Factory. Share a dish family style or bring home the leftovers. I did eat an entire slice of cheesecake once, but I was seven months pregnant, and unless ths is the case or unless you are having a VERY bad day, do not engage in such foolishness. Share.<br><br>Also, order the avocado egg rolls before Michael Bloomberg tries to make these illegal.  These may be more decadent and joy-inducing than the cheesecake, and that&#39;s saying quite a bit.

Very disappointing location. No one seems happy to be there, the food quality has gone downhill, and it&#39;s not an enjoyable experience lately, especially in the last few years. We recently went to the new location at Ridgedale and it was a completely different experience than at this Southdale location. I&#39;m amazed at the difference, but I do know Ridgedale will be our new location to visit.

So awful! We waited for a table for over an hour! The place wasn&#39;t even packed.  When we ordered, it took another 1 hour and 20 minutes. No refills. We decided to leave without eating. Went to PF Chang&#39;s instead and got our food instantly. Luckily we were visiting from out of state for a conference.
Great restaurant, good service and good Food!<br>I loved their cheesecakes!  So many different flavors to pick and I am still trying out different flavors.  <br>Very nice environment!

I just. Don&#39;t know. First of all, get their Bloody Mary. They make their own mix and they are FAB. But I&#39;m confused. I don&#39;t get the theme of the restaurant. The menu is too huge to comprehend. And the food tasted...weird. I got the chicken and waffles Benedict which is like all my favorite things rolled into one and I just couldn&#39;t get past the hollandaise. That can make or break a dish and it definitely broke it. <br>I&#39;ll probably be back though for a bloody.
Great food great service. Management is helpful and attentive. It can be busy so brace yourself. But nonetheless it&#39;s worth the wait for the great service and tons of food options.

Me and my friends came here for on of their birthdays, and it was some of the best service ever. The wait staff are so nice. Also our food was amazing especially the dulce de leche cheesecake! I recommend this to literally everyone
I just wanted a latte. I couldn&#39;t order because the official excuse given was &#34;I am sorry we are out of cups&#34;. Ridiculous!!<br><br>otherwise the place is quite neat

The ambience is as usual what you expect.. the place is bustling with the crowd n its great to be getting the cheesecake factory experience. So talking about he food, I had the Chicken Madeira which was ok. The chicken was tender n mashed potatoes were fine. My wife had the miso salmon which was ok as well. The desert my friends is to die for, we had the Chocolate Tuxedo cream cheesecake which is our favourite n as always, it&#39;s great.

Atmosphere: Warm, elegant, and inviting.<br><br>Service: Depending on when you go, service can take a little while because this is such a popular restaurant. Everytime I have gone, service has been pretty quick for a full house. Everyone also seems friendly and checks on the table often.<br><br>Food: Holy delicious! The menu is HUGE so there is something for everyone. Plus each item is bursting with flavor. Save room for a slice of cheesecake, I recommend the Dutch Apple!<br><br>Price: $$$ Although a bit spendy, it&#39;s worth it. The food is really good and the portions are large so you will definitely have leftovers.<br><br>I&#39;m not sure how this place only has 3 stars, I&#39;m really surprised! If you can afford a nice night out on the town, The Cheesecake Factory comes highly recommended.

Love the Factory and the extensive menu. No one has the depth and variety of menu. From Chinese, Italian, Mexican, Cajun, to meatloaf, where else can you get that variety. But the high end presentation at incredible pricing is the best. Oh, I forgot to mention the cheesecake. That&#39;s for another review.
Food was good, service was slow as hell, lunch bill was messed up (double charged me on lunch entrees and deserts).<br><br>Overall bad customer service, slow service. Food was great.

We had a very delightful holiday lunch last Friday at the southdale Cheesecake Factory. Lovely decor, very delicious food, and great service. We had a veggie burger and a Chinese chicken salad . No room for cheesecake though. Always have had a very enjoyable experience here. Bring money.

I can speak to all the foods served, but these cheesecake factory is highly addictive- in a good way. There was a period where I would make frequent trips to the factory just for cheesecake to go. The restaurant can be busy, but its always worth the wait for the yummy cake.

Still one of our favorites, always tasty food and drink and desert with enough to take home.<br><br>And the service always superior. Special commendation for Nicholas P, he is giving Scott a run for his money for the crown for best waiter in the Twin Cities!<br><br>Obviously a well-managed restaurant.

Came with 8 other people to celebrate my birthday and we order drinks and food she says we&#39;re out of 6 of our orders and they are out of 25 items. And nothing they can do I called corporate after and they wanted to give 20.00 gift card. Manager and corporate was very rude and I and my family will NEVER return. None of there locations

We arrived at 815 pm. Waited the expected 35 minutes like we were told the wait was, which we were fine with. However, when we were seated we waited 20 minutes at our table with no greeting by a waiter, no water provided, we simply sat and waited patiently until we got up and left. NOT acceptable and will not come back

We came on a very busy Saturday night. First off, our server was outstanding! On top of everything, friendly, accommodating etc. <br>my husband had the ribeye and said it was one of the best he&#39;s ever had in a non steakhouse setting-done Medium Rare to perfection, juicy, &amp; tender. I had the Chicken Di Pana. Very moist, flavorful, and very generous proportions! <br>The white Sangria was also fantastic..&amp; strong! ;-) <br>We will be back again. <br>Menu is huge-something for every taste palate. Wait is always long because everyone realizes how great this place is, so I suggest putting your name on the list then doing a little shopping and calling to check in around the time your quoted wait time is up.

So those reviewers who talked about how you should go at an odd time to avoid the wait? Yeah, do that. &#39;Cause if you don&#39;t, you&#39;re gunna have a bad time.<br><br>I mean, I imagine you might. We didn&#39;t, &#39;cause we went at like 4 pm. Smart!<br><br>I got the chicken madeira and a lemon drop martini, and my bf got the smokehouse bbq burger with a long island iced tea. I&#39;m really glad that we decided against an appetizer, because zomg big effing portions. I was so stuffed and couldn&#39;t finish my chicken, which btw was delicious! I had asked the waiter to recommend some stuff to us, since their menu goes on forever (it truly is out of control), and that was one of the things he recommended, so I took a shot. It comes with mashed potatoes, a whole mountain of them, and two flattened chicken breasts breaded with....something, covered in cheese and asparagus, and then there&#39;s this sauce....idk it&#39;s like some kind of gravy that involves crack. All I know is that it was really really good.<br><br>This could also be the lemon drop talking...I&#39;m not sure. It&#39;s entirely possible that they booze you up before the food comes so you think it&#39;s amazing.<br><br>We got cheesecake to go. That tuxedo business...it&#39;s got a lot of chocolate in it, so it&#39;s probably going to be good. <br><br>I can DEFINITELY see how annoying this place could be on a busy night, though. For as much as we enjoyed the atmosphere and the lack of other patrons (although their decor features a repetitive &#34;eye of sauron&#34; theme), by the time we left the annoying mall people and their tiny, loud children were arriving. Don&#39;t get me wrong, I love kids, I just don&#39;t like dining with them.<br><br>So, I guess what I&#39;m saying is go. Go during lunch time...maybe around 1 or 2 pm, and bring a lot of people so you can all get different dishes and then eat off each other&#39;s plates. Then get cheesecake to go.<br><br>The end.

This place is very spacious and buzzing with groups of people-- it&#39;s cheesecake factory located at a mall. I always get spicy chicken chipotle pasta (when I want to splurge) or Chinese chicken salad. Their portions are hugeee. The wait was over an hour long on a saturday night-ish (7-8pm). Great place for groups, drinks, and american food...after all, it&#39;s quintessential suburban family restaurant :)

This place has not disappointed me even before I was yelping. Make sure you leave room for their great selection of cheesecakes and by the way, the only Gluten Free option is the Godiva Chocolate Cheesecake ... how awesome is that!<br><br>They also have a full menu of low calorie options collected in a separate menu. There are a huge selection of options so make sure while you&#39;re waiting to borrow a menu. There are long waits during weekends but it&#39;s also by the mall so you can window shop while waiting.<br><br>If you have kids, they even decorate the desert plate with a happy birthday written on chocolate sauce!<br><br>Again, an awesome place!

It was my first time eating here, we came as a party of 9 and couldn&#39;t rsvp (on weekends) we waited for an hour and 20 mins.. finally got a table only to keep getting bad news that they were out of certain items on the menu and also the menu was pretty overwhelming.. I order lasagna verde and it was so cheesy that I couldn&#39;t swallow it. Every bite was just mozzarella.. the fillings was mozzarella.. I couldn&#39;t taste anything other than mozzarella... it was to the point I couldn&#39;t swallow it anymore and gave up. I enjoyed the tomato sauce but didn&#39;t get much of it.

Does it bug me that they don&#39;t take reservations? Yes. Does that stop me from going anyway? Nope. I&#39;ve been coming here a long time and can honestly say we&#39;ve never left feeling like the food or the service was bad or even just meh; it&#39;s consistently so good. There are even apps that will do delivery from CCF when we don&#39;t want to leave the house and still have an amazing meal.

I often take my family out to eat someplace  to give it a trial run before taking clients or staff out to said place.  I hadn&#39;t heard great things about this particular Cheesecake Factory, but to be honest I am running of restaurants that are close.  My family and I had just ate, but I thought we would stop in for  dessert just to see.  How bad could it be?  Ahhhh...it&#39;s that bad.  I have never went to a restaurant and not been offered a drink.  Myself and my two children ordered a piece of cheesecake.  We were never asked what we would like to drink.  I had to go to the bar to ask for a water.  I would have liked a drink, but wasn&#39;t going to make a separate tab.  We waited for at least 25 mins for the server to come get our check and payment.  The cheesecake was $10 for an okay piece of cheesecake.  The server came back to the table to ask which  credit card was mine.  She picked up several at the same time.  The next day when looking at my account I have been charged $70 for 1 piece of cheesecake without even the offer of a drink.  I called the manager, almost still wanting to give the benefit of the doubt.  As I said, I am running out of new restaurants.  He had an odd mixture of laughing and coughing the entire time he was on the phone.  He asked what time it was.  When I said 8pm, he stated he left at 6:50. What does that have to do with anything? He said if he had to pay $10 for a piece of cheesecake and had poor service he would be mad too.  I was not upset and told him so.  I thought he would want to know that I had poor service and was chaged $70 for 1 piece of okay cheesecake.  After speaking with him I see the problem was not the sever but management.  Not only will I not be back for business.  I will never bring my family.  I hope that I am refunded the extra $60 I was charged.  24 hours later I have not been refunded.

I went here for my birthday celebration. I got seated at a booth. It took the server Richard over 5 minutes or longer to come over and say hi and take my order. The lunch rush was over a long time ago, this was at like 2:45 and there was hardly any people in the lobby or waiting area. Our main course took a long time to come out. And Richard hardly came over to check in and ask if we needed anything. We had to keep looking for him and flag him down. He said the chef walked out and a manager was cooking one of the courses, I think it was the teriyaki chicken. A manager never came over to our table to say anything about this. Food was good but bad service overall. Not a good birthday experience, definitely disappointed.
Went here on New Years Day 2019. Probably the worst food and the worst service I have ever had anywhere!

I got the jumbalya my wife got the superfood salad.The pasta was dry and blan it was supposed to be spicy.But even worse was my wife&#39;s salad one bite was disgusting.I don&#39;t know how she ate more then a few bites.Its like it sat out all day gross.The waitress did a good job.I did not directly complain because my wife insisted.

The hostess&#39; and manager were terribly rude, we waited over 40 minutes to be seated...people that came in after we did were seated immediately! We had originally asked for a booth but we&#39;re told they had no wait staff for booths, we said a table would be fine then and we still were not seated!<br>The manager said we could call corporate to complain but that was all he could do for us.<br>Our waitress however was wonderfully pleasant and knowledgable. She bought us coffee because of the way we were treated when we first arrived.<br>I will say my food was good and so was my cheesecake.<br>I don&#39;t know that I&#39;d ever visit this location again though...
The menu is overwhelming, the wait is ridiculous.  Food is salty as heck!  Ya I said heck, you better get the soap. Overpriced.

Tried the steak... and it is the biggest disappointment ever. Not the worst I&#39;ve had... but pretty bad. No flavor &amp; burnt crisp. All you can taste is a little salt and the burnt bitter. I dont mind paying $30 for a steak... but for $30, I expect it to be well prepared. The salads are good but the nothing special.

I love the food at this place! It&#39;s a go-to for me for celebrating with my girl friends. We had avocado egg rolls and crispy Cuban rolls for our apps, both of which were hot, fresh and tasty. We had a slight wait on the bread because it came right out of the oven, which is OK by me! My savory Chicken Madeira hit the spot, although I also had a bite of the Chicken Costoletta, and I would definitely order that next time because it was light on the breading and the lemon was fresh in a tangy but not overpowering way. I was told the chopped salad was also excellent. We had cheesecake, of course! I branched out from my favorite (White Chocolate Raspberry Truffle) and I was not disappointed with my Caramel Pecan Turtle Cheesecake. My friends highly enjoyed their very chocolaty cheesecakes, too, of which there is quite a variety. <br><br>The server was fun and friendly, but also gave us our space. We enjoyed the outdoor patio setting, which was much quieter and pleasantly warmer than the air conditioned interior, though this was my first time on the patio and I&#39;ve had equally pleasant experiences on my previous visits.

We normally love The Cheesecake Factory. The food and the service are usually great.<br><br>This last time we were very disappointed in the temperature of the plates and the food.<br><br>After the food runners brought our two kids meals and set them down in front of the children, they told us the plates were pretty warm and to be careful. I immediately moved the plate from in front of my 2 year old toddler and was astounded by how searing hot the plate was. I couldn&#39;t even manage to slide it over in front of me without using a folded napkin. My wife and I were both shocked that they would even consider serving children food on a plate that hot. It&#39;s weird because none of the food on the plate was very hot. It could have all been eaten immediately if it weren&#39;t for the ridiculously hot temperature of the plate. <br><br>Shortly after that our food came out, and again the plate was molten red hot magma temperature, but the food was barely above warm. <br><br>Seems like a silly thing to get worked up about, but the part that really made us mad was the manager Jennifer Madison&#39;s reaction to our concern about the plate temperatures for the kids meals. <br><br>She basically insinuated that we were terrible parents for not cutting our children&#39;s food and letting it cool before giving them the plates. (Even though HER runners are the ones that placed the plates in front of the children.) She stated that it was either company policy or a health code issue that required them to place all plates for service in the food window before being brought out to customers regardless of food type or age.  (Horse crap. I&#39;ve eaten at PLENTY of restaurants where I&#39;ve been served food on room temperature plates... and the food was actually hot to boot.) She gave off an air of indifference. I don&#39;t appreciate spending 90 dollars in your restaurant and then being told that our concern was not valid.

Long wait for food. 4 children &amp; 6 adults. Children&#39;s Mac &amp; Cheese was large elbowroni with watery milk at the bottom of tbe bowl that didn&#39;t stick to noodles. I asked the waiter if this is the usual and he said sort of. Children did not eat. Chicken fingers fried too dark. Most of the adult food was sub-par. Tomatoes green and tasteless, avocados hard, pasta not enough sauce, salads tastless, etc. I had not eaten here for 5 years. Live out of state now. I had good memories of this restaurant. Too bad it has changed. I hate to pay for food that is not eaten. In this time of so many restaurants in competition, The Cheesecake Factory needs to make some changes. Wish I had read the reviews before bringing my family there.

This was my first time eating at the Cheesecake Factory. My girlfriend loves it and brought me for my birthday. <br><br>The menu is huge. Anybody should be able to find something they like. <br><br>The staff was very courteous. The waitress stopped back frequently to refill our drinks and was very knowledgeable about the menu. <br><br>I would recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a place to eat and am sure I will be returning in the future.
My wife and I had lunch here with another couple. It was the first time for all four of us. All our meals were fabulous, the waitress was wonderful. I will definitely be going back again.

I prefer to order curbside by phone, however the last couple times the bakery not answered after being on hold for over 30 minutes.   This time I ordered online. The online website is a bit annoying and it blanked out 4x so i had to keep going back and enter my info several times. I got to the restarant and a girl in the bakery answered. She said I ordered two salads. Told her I intended to order one and the total I saw was for just one salad. She stated I would have to come in and make arrangement to talk with the manager. Told her I may need to just cancel then. She then hung up the phone. She was very short and rude during the call as I was explain the situation. I just got done with over 10 hrs of work in customer service and was polite to all of my customers..to.be reprimanded by this girl. I would have spoke with the manager but after being spoke to so poorly and hung up on, I was so put off. I will not return.

I loved Cheesecake Factory, this is usually our go to place when we want a nice quiet lunch/dinner. However today was not the day, out waiter was so rude to begin with, my order was wrong missing ingredients and when I told the waiter she was mad and came back and literally just added the avocado to my super hard tortilla I ordered the skinnylicious tacos which were so gross and this has definitely made my overall experience negative here. When she returned I asked if they can remake the whole thing and she turned around super rude and said I&#39;m getting my manager. No one even asked for her manager all I wanted was my food to be correct. Anyways I would rate a one, but I have had good customer service here before and the food was always good. Definitely not going to this place in a very long time.

I love The Cheesecake Factory. I love the decorations, how large the portions are, how unhealthy and delicious everything is, and that the desserts are as big as my face. If you get the apple crisp, it is bigger than my face.<br><br>When I go to this restaurant it is definitely a treat. I usually order from the skinny menu because I can&#39;t get myself to order from the regular menu. Well, that&#39;s also because I would rather eat dessert than the main dish anyway.<br><br>During this visit, I shared the apple crisp and strawberry cheesecake with a few people. As mentioned before, the apple crisp was HUGE. I do think they have cut down on cheesecake slices. I remember them being so huge a few years back, but recently they are quite small and possibly not sharable.<br><br>I&#39;ll be coming back here to treat myself from time to time. Everything is so delicious!

We have been here once before and the food was great! My husband and I went out to lunch today and decided to get a loaded tater tots appetizer. We were happily munching on said tots until my husband found a bolt/screw in the one he just popped in his mouth. Thankfully he discovered it before biting down too hard. So we flagged down a manager, just wanting for them to be informed of what we found in our food. He was very apologetic, took away the plate and asked if we wanted a new one, we declined. Our meals came and as we were eating the manager came and told us our whole bill will be comped.<br><br>We didn&#39;t tell him about the screw to get a free meal, we actually felt bad eating for free so before we left we put down a generous tip ($20) for the server, because it wasn&#39;t his fault. We were about half way to our car when the server chased us down to tell us what we put on the table didn&#39;t cover our bill so Aaron said &#34;Talk to your manager. I found a bolt in my food and he said we didn&#39;t have to pay&#34; so my husband followed the server back in and told the server to get the manager.<br><br>Unreal that the manager didn&#39;t communicate to the server what happened. That is the first thing that should have been done was to show the server the plate with the screw on it and to zero out our bill. That way we wouldn&#39;t have been chased down like dine-and-dashers. I told my husband  after we left that he should have asked for the tip back.

Entrees are very lacking flavor wise so if you&#39;ve never been and are wanting to try the place out, I suggest going for a couple appetizers and then dessert of course! Can&#39;t go wrong with any of their cheesecakes...Out of the few i&#39;ve tried including oreo, and s&#39;mores, the mango key lime cheesecake is by far the best! If you&#39;re into fruity tasting stuff than this will hit the spot! I&#39;m tempted to stop by tomorrow on my way back from work to get a slice! It is that good!
First time here, for lunch. All the staff were friendly and helpful. <br><br>I got the Lemon Herb Chicken, and loved it but was a bit too sour with the lemon touch, but was still super amazing!
I love how they put the utensils directly on the table! It is so convenient and more sanitary than using a cloth napkin that someone could have blown their nose into!!!

I like the Cheesecake Factory and have been here many times before.  The food and drinks are okay, and as far as my own personal experience goes, the service has always been on point.<br><br>I met a friend today at the Factory for brunch and arrived right as they were opening, so there was no wait and I was promptly seated.  It had been almost a year since I was last at the Factory, so when I went there today, I was surprised that the amount of calories was listed next to almost each item.  The calorie count of certain dishes and slices of cheesecake that I had eaten before shocked me a bit!  One certainly does not go here if one is on a diet!  ;)  At any rate, the server was polite, courteous, and attentive.  I ordered avocado toast, which was OK, and some coffee.  I felt the avocado could have been slightly more well seasoned with a little extra lime and salt, but that&#39;s just me.  I did enjoy the multiple fresh sprigs of cilantro but not sure why there were radishes included.  My friend ordered an omelette with ham.  She assumed the ham would be cut up and incorporated into the omelette, but instead, she was brought a whole slice of ham on a plate.  She told the server about it, returned her plate, and the problem was promptly rectified, and she seemed to enjoy her food.  The serving, of course, was huge, so she wasn&#39;t able to finish it all.  <br><br>As an aside, one of the fun things I like about coming to the Cheesecake Factory is, if it&#39;s your birthday, they will give you a special plate with &#34;Happy Birthday To You&#34; written on the plate in chocolate sauce as well as receiving a free miniature sundae with a candle.<br><br>Bottom line is that I will return here but mostly for special occasions and occasionally meeting people for brunch/lunch.<br><br>Tip (that most may already know):  When planning to go to CF, go right at the time they open or during an evening weeknight, as it will be less busy.

Some of the wait staff was very respectful. There was one who was very rude because it was busy. I had a very unpleasant experience. The managers were very nice by the way. My experience was more with the food and cleanliness. The silverware was very disturbing to the point I did not want to eat of the dishes. I believe u should hand wash and than put them in the dishwasher because that was horrible. The food was beyond disgusting. I heard other customers saying that too. I order buffalo wings and southern country fried chicken sliders as an appetizer. That was a HUGE mistake!!! The Sliders had so much grissle with ever bite I took it had some in it. The chicken wing Had The biggest Vain I ever seen in my life in it, it also seemed undone. Everyone kept asking me if it was undercooked. I did not complain about it though I still payed and tipped because it was not the waitress fault only the cooks.

Great food, great service! And they give you loads of bread and butter. Pricey but it&#39;s fancy! The average wait is normally 30-45 minutes! But it&#39;s definitely, definitely worth it. It&#39;s also a great atmosphere to be in. I love it!

I&#39;m always intrigued by this place. No matter when you go...it&#39;s always packed. I&#39;ve been to a couple of locations and this one is just like the rest. Food is average but you get huge portions. They also have tons of staff... yet always seen to offer very poor service. Maybe the staffing model needs tweaking? Our table, and the ones around us, seemed forgotten about as servers whisked by to other areas. Will I go back? Probably. But the experience is never memorable.

We had the most frustrating experience at the Ceesecake Factory in Edina MN yesterday. 1st the service was very slow and had a shift change. We ordered our food and the new waitress came back and advised they do not have the hibachi steak we ordered. How do you not have the steak?? We ordered the dynamite shrimp for an appetizer which was horrible. We ordered a ribeye medium rare and it came out well done. We were so frustrated at this point and said forget just give us our bill we have been here for 1.5 hours and have had bread and water and the worst shrimp ever. It&#39;s pretty bad when your server tells you she told the chef not to mess up the steak since we have had issues since we sat down. The manager came and said the dynamite shrimp is the worst appetizer on the menu and has requested it to be removed. They could not offer or do anything as it has to go through corporate. Don&#39;t waste your time or money here. We feel this restruant has gone down hill with not only the dated decor but the price you pay for the food. The table behind walked out and the table next to us sent there food back twice. <br><br>.

Excruciatingly bad and slow service this evening. Food took forever to be served and was cold upon arrival. Appetizer never arrived. Special requests forgotten. Dessert ordered to go, added another 20+ minute wait before we could finally get out of there after almost 3 hours. Very frustrating and maddening.

after being on hold for 15 mins. I called back and asked to speak with a manager...(Jen) who was quite snotty herself took my order and said 15-25 mins... 50 mins and $60 later my food was ready - finally. BTW my car was running in takeout parking. I finally get home and it literally looks like some thrown together slop.... <br><br>never again cheesecake factory edina. I&#39;m so disappointed.

We waited over 40 minutes to be seated, which was fine it was Friday and it was expected.  The hostess was the rudest b%$&amp;h ever after we asked why we were called up to be seated then left standing while people behind us were seated because they wrote &#34;2&#34; &amp; not &#34;3&#34;. Really girl, if you hate your job that much....find another!

I have always been a big fan of The Cheesecake Factory, but my last experience made me walk out. First off, when we entered, it took the host staff nearly ten minutes to acknowledge our presence. Walked in at 8:50 and didn&#39;t get acknowledged until 8:58. Then once we were at the table, it just went downhill. We were seated for well over fifteen minutes with no waitstaff to grab us drinks, bread, or water. When I did ask, which was twice, I was told snidely that &#34;this isn&#39;t my assigned section&#34;, and they walked off. I was livid. Meanwhile, the same two which I asked were having casual small talk by the restroom hallway for a good amount of time. I hope management reads this because I love the food and the experiences in the past, and I want to be reassured this will not happen again so I can keep coming back for great experiences.
Always disappointed in the price and size. Except this time my husband&#39;s piece was a good size. Mine ....not so much! They probably gave him a big piece because of the ridiculous kind he chose.

I&#39;ve been here twice before and loved my meals, however tonight&#39;s dishes were a major disappointment. I ordered the Jumbalya and it was so soggy and watery I sent it back after one bite. The waiter didn&#39;t apologize or ask what was wrong, he simply asked me what I&#39;d like instead. I then ordered the Gumbo, as I&#39;ve had it before and remember really liking it. Something must&#39;ve been off with the kitchen, today, though because that was horrible as well. I asked for a to go box and threw away my $18 meal when I got home. <br><br>While my meals were bad, what was worse was the service and our waiter&#39;s apathy toward our experience. <br><br>If you go here, steer clear of the chicken dishes (unless they are deep fried) otherwise, you&#39;ll get chewy, soggy, fatty meat for a minimum of $16 a plate. <br><br>I will say, my boyfriend&#39;s dish (the Habachi Steak) was delicious as were the buffalo wings we split.
Very very very upset that the<br>Chicken Scampi was taken off the menu.  I went there for Mothers Day and told my mother for days how delicious it is only to find out she wont get to try it.
Happy Hour is super affordable. Great drinks (especially the margarita and mojito). Happy Hour is Monday-Friday 4-6pm in the bar area. Come early it gets busy.
Great experience every time!  Great meals, and of course, great cheesecake!  Red velvet is my fave

Went last night to pick up a few slices for a girlfriend and I. I can&#39;t complain about how delicious the dessert is. But the restaurant was chaotic. It was hard to figure out where I needed to go, what line to stand in, and what the process was. A sign or two would help immensely. Service was okay - maybe even good for the amount of pressure the worker was under to keep things going.

We only had to wait 30 minutes for a table, but once we were seated (in uncomfortable wicker chairs in the lounge...at a high bar table), it seemed our server was either too busy or uninterested in serving. It took nearly ten minutes just to come over and take our beverage order. <br><br>I ordered the Tuscan Chicken off of their &#39;skinnylicious&#39; menu. When it came out, it looked like a couple of grilled chicken breasts in a soup-like sauce. And there were SO many baby tomatoes, it was almost overwhelming trying to find the dish. On the menu, it said it came with a &#39;green salad&#39;. I can only imagine that that was smothered somewhere in that sauce. I ate the 3 pieces of chicken and tried to eat the tomatoes but they were just so soaked in sauce that I couldn&#39;t bear to finish it.<br><br>For dessert, I ordered the Toasted Marshmallow S&#39;mores Galore cheesecake. It was good - obviously very rich, but just good.<br><br>The whole ordeal to have our leftovers brought back to us and the bills taken care of us nearly added 15 minutes to our experience. It was just so slow. Food was alright, service left something to be desired.

Went here last night and sat at the bar area to the left for a change of pace, never sat there before.  I&#39;ve been here probably 5 or 6 times, but this time was awesome.<br><br>Our bartender (according to the receipt) was &#34;Ashley P.&#34; and she was one of the nicest people I&#39;ve ever encountered in a restaurant atmosphere.  I would give her 6 Starts out of 5 in terms of service, no joke.  She seemed to have exceptional bar tending skills, and was really knowledgeable about food - she made really good food / dessert recommendations for us.<br><br>Would have given it 5 stars, but I&#39;ve always been a little bitter with this place since I called to inquired about an application I submitted there (this is probably a few years ago now), and the manager that I spoke with on the phone was a complete d**k.  He was a male, and that&#39;s all I remember from that experience.  Hopefully he has been fired or has fallen off the face of the earth by now.<br><br>Both the Red Velvet Cheesecake and triangle-shaped mozzarella stick things I ate were &#34;mouth orgasms&#34; to say the least.  Thought that it was really cool that the kitchen staff knew which people the food went to without us even saying so, very impressive!
Went to eat at the south dale location service was good quality of food poor. Most likely would not return based on poor quality food.

Taj Mahal vibes are strong. Just got cheesecake, and honestly it was just sub-par. Like I love tiramisu but this tiramisu cheesecake was a let down. My friends also thought their cheesecake was sub-par. This is kinda strange cause I&#39;ve eaten at other CFs and it&#39;s been way better. So um come here if you want but please remember 1) It&#39;s a knock-off Taj Mahal and 2) it&#39;s hella overrated

My husband and I visited this restaurant today on our day off.  I was disappointed to find that the customer service was delayed, even though the restaurant was not very busy.  Those thoughts aside, the quality of the food was our main priority.  Having eaten at The Cheesecake Factory with positive experiences, I didn&#39;t doubt this visit would be any different.  I was wrong.  I ordered breakfast (over-medium egg, w/ bacon, English muffin and potatoes).  When my eggs arrived, they were UNDER over-easy, and this comes from a person who actually prefers eggs over-easy.  In addition, my bacon was missing.  My husband order the Louisiana pasta, which was warm, even though the plate was scalding hot.  The sauce in his entree was heavily watered down, with almost soup consistency.  Furthermore, the dish was not well served or in good taste on this particular day.  The food was brought out by someone other than our waitress, which was fine; except at no point did our actual waitress come to check on our table after our food had been received.  I returned my food to have my eggs redone and requested my bacon.  When it was brought back to the table, the eggs and bacon were drowning in oil.  I didn&#39;t bother touching my food after that. I politely asked for the check and promptly left.  I realize everyone has off days, but this visit did not meet expectation.

I&#39;m truly at a loss on how to rate this place. <br><br>It&#39;s one of the most bewildering restaurant experiences I&#39;ve had all year. By the time I left, I had experienced a number of emotions: shock, sadness, horror, anxiety, embarrassment, contempt, and apathy to name a few. My first observation on walking in is how vast the space is, with it&#39;s large booths, presumably to better service it&#39;s large patrons. <br><br>As I took my seat I was given a menu the size of a novella. The sheer amount of choices was immediately overwhelming. For the first time of many that evening, I was forced to face some of the worst traits of American culture. How could a kitchen possibly handle such a hyperbolized variety? Only if your goal is to flame the culinary vanity of a mundane crowd.<br><br>It seemed like mere minutes after I ordered when the food arrived. Apparently in America, you&#39;re not supposed to order slow, and have a relaxed multi-hour dinner with camaraderie. The dining experience here has been reduced to an inhuman mechanical action: get in, eat, get out. In addition, the portions are offensively large, often achieving a caloric density not previously thought possible, perhaps even hitting the upper limits of physics. <br><br>I felt as if I was being grasped at the back of the head, forced to gaze upon America&#39;s disgusting gluttony, to revel in all the waste, to force me to contend with the obesity around me. The worst part? The Cheesecake Factory has no shame; it offers no apology. It accepts this cultural degeneracy, and happily promotes it. There is no noble goal to skirmish with the ignorance of it&#39;s customers, but further raises the curtain. There is certainly no complaint from the eaters, as they stuff their bloated faces. <br><br>Of the things I tasted, they ranged from okay to bad--expected given the size of the menu. The best thing I tried was this delightful little salad that came with my tacos. A tiny paradise amongst the sea of butter, cream, and grease.<br><br>The disturbing experience left me enervated, leaving me to ponder my existential place in this country, and the future of our people. Let this review be a warning to all: if you have any decency or respect for yourself, go somewhere else.

Love the atmosphere. Could use some more options that aren&#39;t over 1,000 calories. My salad was good but my boyfriends mashed potatoes were excellent!  We got the avocado fried wrap as an appetizer which was very unique and good. It is pretty dark in there lighting wise but I like that, think it adds to the ambiance.
Horrible service, the order was wrong twice. The fries were cold, wrong sauce on one of the sandwiches ordered, and my burger was burnt. My family and I waited  over an hour for our food.

It is a fancy restaurant with lots to choose from but food tasted like an average restaurant just expensive. They could do better if they put a little bit of focuse on food rather than decor. Visiting once is okay.

We love Ashley!!! Best bartender ever !!! <br>She is kind, educated about the menu and always has amazing recommendations. It&#39;s like she can read your mind as far as what you desire and don&#39;t on the menu. <br><br>My boyfriend and I go almost every Monday for date night. We love sitting at the bar. The passion fruit margarita is fabulous. My boyfriend loves the coffee selections. <br><br>The Cheesecake Factory has a very extensive menu and something on it for anyone ! I enjoy the salads and I special order the Chicken Di Pana with extra broccoli. <br><br>I believe that, if you want to search for the bad in something you will find it. Fortunately the worst thing I have to say about the staff and menu at the cheese cake factory is that it&#39;s amazing. That&#39;s it guys ! Check it out with an open mind and make sure to sit at the bar and have an amazing experience with Ashley or Ivan.

A very disappointed pregnant girl. I was soooo excited to go eat at cheese cake factory on Father&#39;s Day, yeah we had came later in the evening but I have never once experience the dish I wanted was unavailable. Also the waiter sucked, barley came by to see if we needed refills or even bring the wheat bread when we asked... had an attitude. I end up trying the shrimp and chicken gumbo shrimp was over cooked and did not even look or taste like gumbo. Bf got the meatloaf and the mashed Potato was clumpy and cold, also our fried macaroni and cheese was super dark and hard. It was an awful experience.. I don&#39;t think I can go back even though I love their factory combo and cheese cake.

Good restaurant for a chain. Good food for a chain it takes forever to get seated but once you get seated it goes quick. Food came a lot faster than I expected for how busy it is. The prices are kinda high but the portions are huge. I wouldn&#39;t come back but that&#39;s only because I don&#39;t like chains but this chain wasn&#39;t bad at all.

So my family and I went here the other day... That was a horrible decision. Even though they have like 1 million things on their menu it doesn&#39;t seem like they can even perfect one. I was highly disappointed and over spent way too much money and wasted time here.  It was the equivalent to having food from a frozen bag.  It was not clean I was overcrowded and the food was subpar by all means.  The only thing that was satisfying was the beer, which I might add the waitress delivered the wrong one the first time.  I don&#39;t want to say I hate it but I have a had some great times at CheeseCake when I have gone in the past.  I don&#39;t think I will be visiting here again.
Presentation A1 food AMAZING service like no other! i recommended coming here if you&#39;re looking for amazing food at a cheap price!

We called in the morning to make  a reservation at 5:00 for a birthday gathering for my wife&#39;s father, but Cheesecake Factory said that they wouldn&#39;t take reservations. My wife and were told there wouldn&#39;t be any problem getting in at 5:00. We arrived at 4:45, and there was a one and a half to two hour wait.   Needless to say, our plans were ruined. They shouldn&#39;t have told us that we could get in; we could  have made other plans. My recommendation: don&#39;t go here on a weekend evening unless  you&#39;re prepared for, and don&#39;t mind a two hour wait.

I was so glad to finally be able to eat at the Cheesecake Factory! I had stopped in a few times to just get cheesecake, and was definitely not disappointed! <br>-the red velvet is my favorite, by the way-<br>I went with four friends, and none of us had been here before and it was amazing! <br>I had the Chicken Madeira, and loved every bit of it! It&#39;s highly recommended! <br>I cannot wait to go back again!!
Good foods and place but we don&#39;t wanna go anymore, because good serves it&#39;s the best way to keep customers, but we didn&#39;t get it this time.

So disappointed on my engagement day!!! My boyfriend suprised me and took me here for the first time after he popped the question last weekend. I ALWAYS wanted to come here but never had the chance. First we waited 40 mins to get seated WITH a reservation. Second of all they brought me the wrong food! I ordered farfalle chicken &amp; garlic which had tomatoes in it and I told the server I am allergic to tomatoes when ordering and on top of that they did not include the mushrooms in the dish which I love mushrooms. I had to send my dish back due to the tomatoes and was told it would be 30 mins to get it remade. Instead of waiting my fiance shared his chicken Madeira which was good but Luke warm when they brought it to our table. The best part of the meal was the calamari, the banana cream and white chocolate rasberry cheesecake. The service wasn&#39;t that great either we had to wave down our server for drink refills and waited 30 mins after we were done eating for the check. Sadly this is not what I would of expected for a nice restaurant. As much as I wanted to love this place they did not deliver on a very special, memorable day.

When going in the evening the lights are down low to the point you have to literally use your phones flashlight to read the oversized menu. I have definitely had some good tasting dishes and cheesecake but the Alfredo Chicken Pasta is horrible. There is literally no flavor whatsoever. I&#39;d never waste 19.99 on noodles, can sauce, and a tiny piece of charred chicken. The cheesecake is also overpriced. $18 for 2 pieces? Come on!

Why a 3 and not a 4. Not sure. I haven&#39;t been here in about 3 years. Happened to be shopping Southdale. Put our name in- it was a 40 minute wait. We took the buzzer and walked the mall. We knew we wouldn&#39;t get beeped out of range. Came back and when we checked in they took us off hold. Some restaurants would have said too bad and put us back at the end of the line. Points scored! We ordered the chopped salad and the veggie burger. Both were good not amazing but really good. What surprised me was how attentive and good our service was. I poo poo chains but this one isn&#39;t bad!
The food was amazing, but the service was truly slow. We read some other reviews before coming but still decided to dine. Things are pricey but delicious. VERY SLOW THOUGH

Emphasis was on &#34;Factory&#34; that night (11/26), especially with a party of 8. <br><br>It started off odd. We had been told there would be a 15-20 minute wait. We were standing around (all seats/benches occupied with other wanna-be diners) for about 5 minutes when the pager went off. Excited that the wait was shorter, I showed others in our party and turned around to the host stand. Some host/manager guy said, hey, it&#39;s going to be about 15-20 minutes. I didn&#39;t know how to process the information, so I just said, &#34;um, yeah, you already told us that.&#34; I thought about it and the people behind me that thought we were going to sit down and said, &#34;really, you paged me over here to tell me that? I thought our table was ready.&#34; If it was a huge change in wait, I could see that, but it was more just odd.<br><br>The food was mostly well-prepared, but the service was uneven. Any time you have people at the table going, &#34;oh, you guys go ahead and eat,&#34; you know there&#39;s trouble because enough time has elapsed that everyone&#39;s wondering where everyone else&#39;s meals are. There was about 5-10 minutes between the first plate and the last plate getting laid down. And no, no one ordered anything unusual or wanted special modifications. It was a weird night service-wise. The server was very personable and attentive at the table, but it took a while for drinks and bread, then we&#39;d have these gaps of time where we wouldn&#39;t see him for a while.<br><br>Their drink menu has a section of martinis - but none of the drinks on it are martinis, they&#39;re just these weird made-up sugary concoctions of bizarre flavor combinations. There was - honest to God - not a single martini on the page. I had to manually order a martini, specify an actual gin, and ask for olives. Sheesh! And it basically sucked. I hate that word, but it fits in this case. Made me feel like a idiot even ordering it. Oh well.<br><br>Oh well, and about the menus, this is rich. These guys are so hard up for money, that they actually put ads for other stuff inside their menu. Not some food tie-in, just other stores at the mall (Southdale). So while I&#39;m looking over the ridiculous non-martini Martini section, on the opposite page, I have some model leering at me with tacky-looking jewelry from some store in the mall. Ha!<br><br>Another pet peeve - I ordered one of their burgers with fries. The fries came in a little metal bucket with a paper liner. The fries were just luke warm. Everyone that wanted to try one did what I did - ate 1-2, then no more. They&#39;re just gross when they&#39;re not hot. Oh, and if you&#39;re serving a burger with fries, you bring ketchup. Don&#39;t make me ask for it. That&#39;s another few minutes of waiting right there. They didn&#39;t even bring a bottle, just a little dressing bowl with a dollop of ketchup in it. Boo!<br><br>Okay, soapbox mode off, but it was a strange dining experience. Oh, and yes, they do serve cheesecake.

The service was excellent. The one problem I had was one of the pasta dishes. Tomato basil pasta, it was good,  but there was too much garlic. It pretty much overpowered the dish. I left with a horrible nasty taste of garlic.. I am choosing a different dish.

I guess you could say I&#39;m a big fan of The Cheesecake Factory. I have never had anything here I didn&#39;t like. Their menu is a little out of control with all the options, but everyone should be able to find something they want. <br><br>The wait staff is great, they have always been very friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable of the 20 page menu. <br><br>The food is always fantastic, and you can&#39;t leave without a piece of their cheesecake. If you like chocolate, I would suggest the Godiva Chocolate Cheesecake, it&#39;s like having chocolate silk in your mouth.  <br><br>Parking at Southdale is annoying, and sometimes you have to wait, a long time, but if you plan it right and don&#39;t come during busy times, you&#39;ll be seated right away.

Overpriced. But I seen that a lot on here and I had a gift card, so I had to use it eventually (don&#39;t typically go to eat at places connected to a movie theatre)  had about a 3rd of my meal dumped on me by whoever brought the food out. Her only response was &#34;this happens all the time&#34; and then she ran off. When the waiter came back and asked how was everything, I told him it was ok despite a large portion being dumped on me, his response even better, &#34;how rude&#34; as he hurried away.

I&#39;m reviewing purchasing cheesecake to go from the counter.  I have eaten here before, but I hate the food.  Everything I&#39;ve ordered has been terrible.  I think they should stick to cheesecake, but anyways... on to my actual review.<br><br>I&#39;ve ordered cheesecake several times to go from here.  Cheesecake is good, and the Cheesecake Factory does it best (most of the time).  I picked up two pieces for Valentine&#39;s Day - Cookie Dough and Kahlua.  One old favorite and one new flavor, which is how we generally do Cheesecake Factory takeouts.  The Cookie Dough we had tried before and LOVED.  This time, it had walnuts all over the top.  We do not recall that from last time, and for me walnuts kill it.  I thought it was actually nasty with nuts on it.  Very disappointing.  The Kahlua was good though.  Cookie Dough I&#39;ll never order again now.<br><br>The biggest downfall this time was that I left with two very small slices of cheesecake and spent $18.  They&#39;ve halved their slices and increased the price.  They have good cheesecake, sure, but they are bordering on robbery at this point.  It ain&#39;t THAT good, guys.  Maybe tone down the ripoff factor before you&#39;re charging 20 bucks per chew.

I love this place! I live 30 minutes away and always make a trip to get some of their red velvet cheesecake. The service is average but the food makes up for it. Some of my favorites: fried zucchini, Louisiana chicken pasta, and brown bread (free). The menu is very large and it is easy to get overwhelmed.

Worst experience we have ever had I would give 0 stars if i could. We waited for over an hour for our food then the manager brought it out and said she was sorry but they messed up and had to recook one of our meals. Then when we tried to eat the food it was obvious what they had done. They let the food sit and then tried to reheat it. The food was cold and soggy bit the plates were hot. And if this was not enough the manager came back and said she was not going to charge us for the food, my response was well thats good since we cant eat it anyway. Now after an hour drive to get there, 40 min waiting for a table and 1 hour waiting for food we still have to go get dinner. This is most certinaly not what we expect from the cheese cake factory and to make matters worse it was my wifes birthday dinner.  We wont be going back.

I would like to say to food taste was great Great job kitchen staff. But have to say this restaurant has gone down hill like a lot of the establishments here in Edina Mn .I am not sure how these restaurants get away with serving dirty dishes to the customer and management and the health department thinks it&#39;s ok . I have been a professional Chef for over 10 years and that would not fly in any of my restaurants. Accidents happen but to have five count it three forks a plate and food in the water glass that I never drank out of. That should tell you how many people our eating with dirty utensils at this establishment . I would warn the public beware someone is going to get sick and the manager does not care .  SO PLEASE BE SAFE IF YOU TAKE THE CHANCE AND EAT IN EDINA MN YOUR MAY BE SORRY LATER.
Love this place, very classy, we went for lunch, great food, good size portions. Our server was very friendly, offered a variety of choices both for meals and cheesecake!

I know this is a chain, so forgive me since this is the only one in the Twin Cities.  This location is adorable and classy on the inside.  I will say that they don&#39;t take reservations for large groups and it can be difficult trying to squeeze everyone in (we ended up being split into adjacent booths).  I prefer heading in for lunch, but not always in the area to do so. The cheesecake is pretty badass.

Went in waited 46 minutes to get food. Bartender even said our food was 15-20 minutes late than usual. Wait Nd finally ask for bread. We finally get our food it wasn&#39;t hot it was warm to touch! Then I start eating Nd there&#39;s pork in my food!!!! Mgr comes n has some nerve to give me a bill for my bf food yet his got cold waiting to get my food corrected. I left crying bc I DONT eat pork Nd the mgr acted like it wasn&#39;t that big of a deal. Had nerve to ask if I wanted food remade so I can wait another 20-25 minutes for FRESH HOT FOOD. Yet my bf food is cold now Nd want to give me a bill for it. Horrible management nd service. I truly felt bc we were of minority&#39;s we didn&#39;t get the service most did. I found it funny how couples who came in 30 minutes later had food yet a refill on our drinks wasn&#39;t happening. Then I get an email yet NOTHING IS DONE! This location is by far the worst. NOBODY HASNT EVEN ATTEMPT went in AGAIN THINKING ANOTHER CHANCE NOPE I FOUND A TOOTHPICK A TOOTHPICK A USED ON IN HALF  PIECE IN MY MASH POTATOES DONT COME HERE ITS A WASTE OF MONEY THE WORSE MANAGER THERE IS THE HISPANIC ONE LIKE HES JUST A WASTE

My experience was truly appalling. The food we ordered was given to the table next to us. We understand that this happens, but the person that delivered the food (not our waiter) left and the person at the other table started picking through the dish noticing it wasn&#39;t what he had ordered and asked his companion to try it to see what she thought it was. When the server came back with the parmesan, the gentleman asked if this was what he ordered. The server went back to the kitchen with the dish to check and came back out WITH THE SAME DISH and turned to our table and said &#34;This is actually yours&#34; and SET IT DOWN IN FRONT OF ME! When I made a face she said &#34;It hasn&#39;t been eaten, but I can exchange it if you really want&#34; to which I replied that I would appreciate a new dish. She rolled her eyes and went back to the kitchen. When our &#34;new&#34; food was brought out, my companion&#39;s dish was hot and fresh and mine was cold...and the same dish that had been previously delivered, fork marks and all. At this point I was frustrated and picked at the dish until our waitress returned in time to box up our food. When she came with our bill we told her what all had occurred. She was sincerely apologetic and said she would inform her manager and have him stop by our table. The manager never came by. I am outraged that any establishment would try to reserve food mistakenly given to another table that HAD BEEN TOUCHED even after I specifically asked for a new dish. Disgusting.

Our server totally ruined our experience in my opinion. I would have given this place a much higher rating had she not been such a b*&amp;%h. She had no emotion, was pretty rude, obviously didn&#39;t want to be there...and made it really obvious. When we said goodbye to her, she didn&#39;t even say anything even though there&#39;s no way she couldn&#39;t have heard us. RUDE.<br><br>Anyway, the food here was fine - we came for chocolate chip cookie dough cheesecake and appetizers. The cheesecake was really good and a generous sized portion but really, really rich. I&#39;m not sure my stomach can handle this anymore. <br><br>My Mom had the potstickers and my Dad had the chile rejos (have no clue how to spell that) and they both seemed to like them.<br><br>Like every cheesecake factory, this place has an impressive selection of food and is generally pretty consistent. Just don&#39;t sit in the bar with the totally rude server. <br><br>$25-ish in total plus tip. Standard for this kind of place.
Worst service ever! I called for take out and over an hour and forty-five minutes later, still no food. They were very nonchalant about the entire thing.

If you&#39;re looking for a place that is open after midnight then you found it. Yea, I was surprise too! They are open till 12:30am on fri and sat.. regular days till 10pm<br><br>I admit, I&#39;m a fan of this chain. the service is always satisfactory and the price is very reasonable. Because this is the only cheesecake factory in the state of minnesota, it&#39;s always busy. Expect to wait 40 mins during dinner hrs BUT only 10 mins during the late weekend. Like I&#39;ve mentioned on my tip, I&#39;m a devoted  lover of their Fettuccini Alfredo w/ chicken. I&#39;ve been ordering the same dish for the past 12 years. It&#39;s so rich in cream and the sun dried tomatoes definitely adds a zest to the taste. I also would recommend their miso salmon- the glazed salmon and rice goes perfect together. i tried to mimic their garlic noodles at home- mission failed. I&#39;ll stick to ordering from cheesecake instead.<br><br>as far as cheesecake goes, i like their white chocolate truffle and the Oreo one is great too.... but if you like red velvet like i do, skip the cheesecake and go for the ultimate red velvet cake instead!
We went with the family and the server was great. He did so good. My brother in law was happy and is very very hard to please him. Great job. I love the fettucini alfredo. Will come back again.

The Cheesecake Factory has been around forever, and yet, is still popular enough to encounter a 40-minute wait at 1:45 p.m. on a Saturday. Crazy. <br><br>I usually dodge requests to go to the Cheesecake Factory because I&#39;ve never not encountered a wait, but I relented over the weekend. The upside to waiting is that you can head into the mall and do some shopping as you wait for a table to open up. The buzzer won&#39;t work, but staff are good about letting you know an appropriate time frame for coming back. <br><br>The menu here is just obscenely huge. Whatever you&#39;re hungry for, they probably have it. I ordered just a basic hamburger and was pleasantly surprised by how perfect it was. No frills, just cooked to order and tasty. <br><br>My dining partner got the club sandwich and was also happy with her order. We split a piece of white chocolate raspberry cheesecake for dessert and while it had an excessive amount of whipped cream decorating the top, it was delicious. <br><br>Wait staff here are very good - attentive and friendly. If this place took reservations, I wouldn&#39;t hesitate to head back soon.

Had an amazing dinner at the Cheesecake Factory, the Thai lettuce wraps for an appetizer were amazing, and so big! The food came right after our appetizer. The whole experience was fast and delicious and our serve was perfect! Our drinks were to die for too!

Not impressed. If I pay 120$ for 3 entrées, 1 app, 2 drinks &amp; 2 desserts I expect way better. Service was slow. They got our order wrong twice. Tip to wait staff: if u r refilling a drink, 1st bring the new one THEN take the original away. Don&#39;t take my drink to remember what to bring back. Wait staff left fallen dirty utensils on the floor. Bathroom (ladies) was dirty, garbage overflowing. We left our app plates at edge of table when we were done. Waitress left them there as she walked by sev x. I left my credit card on edge of table for many minutes trying to get someone to take our dessert order and get our bill bc we were late for a movie. Ok. That said food was REALLY good. Way too many restaurants to try close by. Don&#39;t bother w this one.

I visited this restaurant with two friends. We went in on early evening time and were seated after 10 min wait. The waiter came over and asked us for our orders. We told him to give us few minutes to review the menu. We finally ordered and our food took almost half an hour to come out. When the food came out 2 out of 3 were messed up. We complained to the waited and he didn&#39;t seem concerned. He responded if you need to complain i can get you a manager. They didnt bother even correcting the orders. When manager came out he sounded like he is used to such complaints and asked us what he should do. Worst part, the two people who had their food messed up both got food poisoning the next day. I missed work for almost two days because of the food i was given. Overall experience was terrible and i will never go back to this restaurant again. I warned my family members and friends about this place and the terrible experience we had.
Love the shrimp scampi &amp; combos...happy hour aps are great deals and food  comes out always PERFECT.....Love it!!!

Usually the restaurant does a good job. Servers are nice and the food is great. Today, my server was not very attentive. She seemed to avoid her tables, didn&#39;t bring bread out until 30 min after we sat, we asked the host for water refills and the two tables next to us had empty beverages. Someone at our table didn&#39;t get her salad.

Service was slow and server was distracted and inattentive. We waited 40 after ordering for the food and missed our movie. When we finally received the food, it had been made incorrectly and had to be sent back. The manager seemed unwilling to do much about it.

If I had to give you a grade for our latest experience or would be an F- ! Normally we love it but after this time I doubt that we will ever return. I am a current restaurant manager and Having been in the restaurant industry for over 15 years I of all people understand being busy and how things happen.  for starters we arrived at the restaurant at 5:50 on a Saturday, they quoted me about an hour wait for my family of 5, my wife and 12yr old 9yr old and 3yr old, which was fine and expected so we took that time to walk around the mall and have a nice family evening together we ended up being seated at 6:30 so less than an hour which was great! All was good we were having fun and enjoying our night, our server stopped by right away and brought our drinks in a timely fashion and we placed our order for our appetizers at 640, but that is where the good ends. The music was so loud the server had a hard time hearing us order. then our spinach dip and Tex-Mex egg rolls took about 15 minutes and our spin dip was delivered first and the chips were so greasy and shiny there was a pool of Grease on the plate under the chips which we told the food Runner who brought our food out about when they brought our egg rolls 8 minutes later, then took another 7 min for new chips.  we placed our dinner order about 7:15. at 8:00 our server stopped back and apologized for the wait for the food.  dinner was delivered at 8:07 well everything but my son&#39;s parmesan crusted chicken.  by now my 3yr old had fallen asleep.  her mac and cheese looked as though it had sat in the window for 30min, bowl was extremely hot and the top layer was dry and crusty with no cheese in sight... my buffalo chicken sandwich was not crispy by any means it was sopping in Greece and the bun was hard and dry and the fries were smushy, my wife&#39;s cashew chicken was burnt and crispy, my son&#39;s parmesan crusted chicken finally came out at about 8:15 and was not crusted at all the breading was wet and slushy on the chicken which the manager had ran out and that was the first we had seen or heard from a manager all night. the manager then took our food and offered to get us something else but did not come back for another 15 minutes, when he came back we told him about my son&#39;s chicken and decided against ordering food that was going to take another hour and just decided to order some cheesecake to go. by then we had been there for over two and a half hours, and had expected the manager to stop back.  he never did.  our to go cheese cake took another 20 min.  I tried to find the manager but noticed that standing and talking to a few servers was more important to him than guest satisfaction. the server proceeded to drop off a check at 8:47. I told her we were not paying for anything tonight as none of its even ate dinner and we had now been there for going on 3 hours.  Absolutely terrible and disappointing.  never once in that entire time we were there did I see a manager touch a single table,  more did they seem to care if we would be back or not.  as a location of a corporate chain you cannot simply rely on the popularity of your brand to keep business. we will definitely not be back and I have passed this experience on to everyone I know and everyone I spoke with agreed that Southdale Cheesecake Factory food quality and service are going down the toilet which is sad to see cuz I myself used to work for Cheesecake Factory and know the standards that are to be held in that restaurant

The Cheesecake Factory is really good! I love the Four Cheese Pasta. It has all these different cheeses in a pinkish sauce with penne. Then there&#39;s ricotta cheese in the middle. It was AMAZING. Literally. The service is very good but the reason I gave it 4 stars is the wait. Didn&#39;t expect a table right away and I guess for this restaurant 1 hour 10 minutes isn&#39;t that long. The cheesecake is really good, and I don&#39;t even like cheesecake. Very good for birthdays or special occasions.

We&#39;re from Chicago and visited Minneapolis for Father&#39;s Day weekend. My husband and I couldn&#39;t agree on a &#34;new&#34; restaurant to try, so we decided to go to Cheesecake Factory because in Chicago it&#39;s always a solid choice; food is always good and you know what you&#39;re getting. Sadly, this wasn&#39;t the case at this location. We ate here twice on this trip and we were disappointed both times. <br>The first meal was dinner. I ordered the Ne Orleans Shrimp, which is a dish I&#39;ve had frequently at Cheesecake Factory&#39;s all around the country. On this particular occasion, it was cooked with the wrong sauce (it was yellow) and it had a curry-like taste to it. This ruined my entire meal and it was really late, so I didn&#39;t have the energy to complain and wait for a new meal to be prepared.<br>The next meal we had here was brunch on Father&#39;s Day. We ate here mostly be use of convenience. Every other restaurant had a long wait and we were trying to make it to the Twins game. Anyway, my husband ordered egg whites, ham, and toast. My son&#39;s ordered &#34;crispy&#34; bacon with their meals. So, all of the food came out except my husband&#39;s. The waitress said that the cook forgot to only cook egg whites. So, about 7 minutes later, my husband gets his food with steaming hot eggs and cold meat and toast........yummy!!! Next, they only brought bacon for one of my sons and it was no where near crispy. We requested crispy bacon again and the waitress attempted to take my 4 year olds entire plate of pancakes back to the kitchen, just to get crispy bacon. The distraught look on his face was all she needed to sit the plate back down and she said she would just bring a side of bacon. So, she shows up about 1 minute later with some COLD crispy bacon. I imagine this was pre cooked bacon used to top salads and/or soups, because it obviously wasn&#39;t cooked that fast. We were tired of going back and forth an my son starting eating it so we just left it alone. My other son&#39;s bacon was never brought out, but we just told our waitress to take it off the check. So........on future trips to Minneapolis, we now know that Cheesecake Factory IS NOT an option and we would NOT recommend this place to anyone. PAY ATTENTION TO THE LOW STAR RATING ON YELP!!!!
Average appetizers and entrees.. Great dessert options. Service is hit or miss Always crowded and a bit cramped for space

Food was good, but not for the price. Really expensive, for two adult meals, one kid meal, non-alcoholic drinks, and two pieces of cheesecake, bill was about $80. I&#39;ve had better food at Applebee&#39;s.  Service was good though. The wait was long, but that was expect used since it is a popular place to visit. The restaurant was clean and neat, bathrooms were also clean.

Life in a restaurant inside a mall. Hmm not much my scene. Standard chain restaurant food. Excellent service here on two occasions! Really awsome happy hour! I think these places will do ok with all the new apartments going up around southdale.

This place is always packed since it&#39;s the only one in the city. I think of it kind of as an upscale family restaurant, that&#39;s neither really good at one thing or the next. We waited 40 min for our entrees on a Sunday night. Food portions are decent, but overall you could probably find better versions of their items at different restaurants, ie pasta at an Italian restaurant

Good grief, I have gone to this location maybe 8 times for dinner with the family, it has gotten worse each and every time to the point I have said never again. Last time was 3 disgusting glasses with stuff floating in them and one with what appeared to be chocolate chunks in my scotch along with a few dirty utensils.<br>Tonight was crazy dumb. My chicken and cashew was not good enough for crows to eat. A gross unflavored breaded and deep fried chicken (the same chicken in one of my kids Orange chicken) with a sauce you couldn&#39;t make that bad if you tried to make someone sick, no spice and flavor of dirty leather. One had the catfish and liked it, one pasta (which is always fair) the other Sheppard pie ( better than mine but thyme and burger I can make at home in 4 minutes) .<br>Service from our waitress Alex was well below normal, with virtually no concern of what anyone  thought of the food and two dishes taken away, eventually, with no questions as to why we wanted no boxes and nothing was eaten -gross.<br>Desert only if you go and make sure you plate, silverware and glass is clean.<br>We have had some super sweet servers over the years here but tonight&#39;s was crazy bad.

I get that the identity is their cheesecake, but the pasta tasted like play-dough covered in salt sauce. I vowed never to eat here again but I keep getting pulled back in by someone craving cheesecake, and even when I try to explain that their cheesecake is average, they don&#39;t listen! Seriously most of the variations of cheesecake they have are just gross and excessive, even the standard is nothing special.
Great food, quick to seat.  Cooks slow and waitress said they were new. Crispy crab Rangoons looked liked it had burnt ends but was tasty.

First time eating at this location. Restaurant was clean, the service was excellent and the food was awesome. The desserts were hard to pick from because they all sounded good.  In the end we tried an Oreo and Smore  cheesecake along with a Stawberry shortcake. I would eat here again for sure.

The restaurant is nice.  The atmosphere is great but they cut your cheesecake thinner then other cheesecake factories. I feel like if I&#39;m going 2 pay $8.50  for a slice of cheesecake then cut me a decent slice. Customer service was decent.

I know and understand the complaints about the Cheesecake Factory and the fact that this restaurant is trying to cater to Edina residents with its&#39; decor while catering to the Sumo Federation of America with its&#39; portions, I really can&#39;t complain based on the fact that huge portions make me happy.  It&#39;s overwhelming to look through the menu with no idea what you&#39;re feeling like so I would suggest picking a genre of food before showing up or you may find yourself in desperate tears while the waitress looks at you with a knowing condescension.  <br><br>It really is lovely inside and the food is better than PF Changs.  <br><br>What - it is.
Noisy, slow service. Quality of the food was poor.<br>Saturday night is definitely not the time to go.<br>So dark it is hard to read the complex menu.<br>We had to wait n hour to be seated.

Bartender has good service skills. He even caught my bill mistake before I had a chance to say something to him. My food got skipped, and he personally checked to see what was going on. Unfortunately the food isn&#39;t nearly as good as it used to be. And it is more overpriced that it used to be.

What happened to this place?? Service is so slow!! Bar is so slow!! Kitchen is so slow!! And the Kitchen can&#39;t seem to get the orders right. A real disappointment. Been there 30 times and it&#39;s really gone downhill.

This is definitely a beautiful place inside and out. This place is great for large groups and a place to take people from out of town. The service is always outstanding. They have something for everyone but on downside to that the menu can be overwhelming it is actually a book. Great happy hour specials on apps and drinks. This is definitely a place that I will always go back to. Avocado Eggroles, Louisiana Chicken Pasta, and Dulce De lecha Carmel Cheesecake, so so good, and Fresh Banana Cream Cheesecake I don&#39;t really even like bananas but the banana is not overpowering. Very good. I have also been wanting to try breakfast/brunch I bet it will be awesome.

The wait time was incredibly long, but sometimes that happens. The food was great, however our waitress was very snappy and did not care to give us the time or the courtesy to take our time to decide on what we wanted. She mainly just wanted to get us out as soon as possible to bring another group in. Other than that experience, we enjoyed the food and the environment.
