White chicken chili was quite good, though more like a chicken gumbo than a white chili.

The food is medium - their salads are large in size and delicious, but some of their other items are basic. I highly recommend the luau salad and the avocado egg rolls. I also love the brown bread - it&#39;s one of my favorite things even though the basket comes with every meal.

Lots of food for the price and friendly service.  A young adult hangout spot that isnt in minneapolis.<br><br>Ive had a ton of stuff on the menu and its always great.<br><br>Get here early on friday or saturday nights.<br><br>Waits can sometimes be 1-2 hrs.

Went here for date night. Partially because it was only 1 of 2 places we could actually find in a mall over-run with people just &#39;hanging out&#39; before seeing the new Star Trek movie (Awesome).<br><br>Place was packed so we sat at the bar, next to a 3 year old. Is that even legal?<br><br>Maddie and Tasha were very attentive and chatty, probably because they were 2 of 5 employees behind the bar.<br><br>Drinks were reasonable but found the food nominal and over priced. Overall it would have been a better deal to stick to my neighborhood places (I live in downtown Minneapolis) but they closed the movie theater in Block E.

This is definitely my go to restaurant for any special occasion. Always a great experience and great food. They literally have pages and pages of options for you to choose from so your sure to find something no matter your mood. Tons of Oh em gee Cheesecake flavors too of course. Nice atmosphere and pretty decent staff that always hustling to bring you a nice dining experience :)

It&#39;s a Cheesecake Factory. What more needs to be said?!<br><br>Realistically, it&#39;s probably only a 4-star joint, but because my wife and I live in Fargo now we have to drive all the way here for a Cheesecake Factory or P.F. Changs. We miss living in a real city, and this place makes our visits all the more special.
They have great desserts which most people know about. Beyond that there is not much to venture out for. The place is loud and difficult to hold a conversation.

My daughter and I recently had dinner at the Cheesecake Factory at Southdale Center in Edina. Prior to this visit I had always had good food and service. But after this experience I will never go back. We waited an hour for our food. The table next to us was seated, ordered, ate their food and left and we had still not gotten our food. When we inquired, we found out our food had been made but was put aside and our server did not know. Then again, she never checked. Our meal tasted like it had been sitting out for an hour. Wilted salad and lukewarm burger and fries. We did speak with the manager who was very gracious and gave us complimentary cheesecake which was wonderful. I appreciate the cheesecake, but unfortunately we will not be back.
Service was absolutely amazing and fantabulous. The Thai glazed salmon was the best seafood I&#39;ve ever had. Love it.

I used to really enjoy this place when it first opened at the Southdale Mall in Edina MN. So many amazing dishes. Good service. And cheesecake!  I think it goes downhill from time to time, though.  A few years ago, I found that the floor was too slippery and greasy and the restrooms had missing doors. No problem with that now. But has it always been as dark as a cave? This is the second time I&#39;ve been there when it was so dark that I had to use the flashlight on my cell phone to order.  And I don&#39;t recommend the crab and artichoke dip. The &#34;grilled bread&#34; that comes with it is really just awkwardly oversized rough croutons.  No fun to eat. Besides, the dip is too salty.  I sent it back.  Service was s-l-o-w.  Oh, Goodness!  We got seated right away; it was not that crowded.  But getting each thing took a ton of time.  We were there about two hours.  They were out of the cuban sandwich I&#39;d planned to order, so I settled on the miso salmon.  There are just 5 snow peas in that dish. And the white rice I ordered turned out to be brown instead. I liked the waitress, but I she did not do that well for us. Other than that, it was OK. My husband&#39;s egg dish was perfect.  I will try them again in a year or so. Or not.  A little pricey for this level of disatifaction.

First and last time we go here due to awful customer service. My wife and I came after a movie since it was one of the few places open after 10 pm.  We were seated by a hostess that hardly acknowledged us. We sat outside. It was not particularly crowded. After putting our order in, a guy came over to tell us there was a glitch in the system and asked again for our order and he would get it in right away. After that we received a soup fairly quickly. 30 minutes later, the waiter came to clear the bowl. We told him to cancel the drink order that never came. 15 minutes later, my wife&#39;s order came which was essentially apiece of bread with some avocado spread on it so not sure why it took over 45 minutes.  At that point, I asked the server (who was not our waiter)if my order was coming and if not to cancel the order. The waiter came back a few minutes later and I asked for the check. He said the manager would come over though I hadn&#39;t asked for that. He brought the check and the soup and the avocado toast were in the bill. We split my wife&#39;s toast, the manager never showed and we left cash and left. There were so many ways they could have made this a better experience. Apologizing would have been nice. A discount or the manager actually showing up would have helped. A drink or dessert might have helped. Instead they received a lousy review and a customer that will never go back. I have been to Cheesecake Factory&#39;s all over the United States and this was hands down the worst. Although the food was pretty good, this experience turned me off to this so-so chain for good. I totally fault the management for not training or overseeing the inexperienced wait staff. There seemed to be other tables handled by competent staff, but we had at least 3 we came in contact with that did not seem to have a clue.

It was a little busy but we found a place at the bar. And boy are we glad we did! A young man by the name of Patrick was our bartender- he was friendly and knowledgeable about the menu- thank god because there was a lot to choose from! I had the Ruby red sunrise and my partner had a Pineapple Moscow mule. It was a special visit for us mainly due to the outstanding service! Great job Patrick &amp; the Edina Cheesecake Factory!

A restaurant chain I would probably never have intentionally walked into to have dinner at back home in Cali..... became my birthday dinner spot.  I hear this is the only Cheesecake Factory in Minneapolis?  Or.. Minnesota??!!!<br><br>Well, nonetheless, I had a great meal!  I had their chicken something... it was crispy on the outside and served with asparagus and mashed potatoes!!  The mashed potatoes were my fave and their rye bread, of course!<br><br>One of my friends ordered the kobe burger, but since they cooked it wrong, it took another 15 minutes or more for her dish to come out.  The rest of us were almost done by then.  The manager was extremely kind though.  He came out himself to apologize and made sure that her meal was on the house and a free cheesecake too.<br><br>For a &#34;family restaurant&#34; though, I found it a little awkward how they were playing baby-making music when the restaurant already had some dim lighting........ <br><br>Haha<br>Had a great meal.

I am a gluttonous man and I don&#39;t care if you judge me. Bring out an extra biscuit, because I will mop up the gravy all day long.<br><br>It&#39;s not chalked full of character here, but you get consistently good food and service. The food is high quality and the restaurant is clean. Those two things alone put this restaurant in a very elite category. <br><br>Great variety on the menu and awesome desserts. The only negative is the wait... They could build  second Cheesecake Factory next door and you&#39;d still have an hour wait on a Tuesday night. Otherwise, we love this place.

I went here for dinner with my boyfriend tonight.  It&#39;s always so busy when I go there and this was no exception.  There wasn&#39;t a wait to get seated which was nice, but it was so loud inside.  <br><br>I ordered the arugala salad and fried zucchini.  While waiting for our food, we both noticed how incredibly cold it is inside.  We were hoping our server would offer us a blanket with our meals.  No such luck.  <br><br>My boyfriend ordered a chicken sandwich and fries and our server said his fries would just be a minute.  He was half done with his meal by the time the fries came.  My salad was delicious.  It had raisins, almonds, and lemon.  It was really zesty and yummy.  The fried zucchini was alright but I couldn&#39;t eat very many of them.  These would be better shared with a group.  You get around 9 pieces, each about the size of a wedge cut fry.   The fries that the boyfriend ordered were extremely salty.  I tried the fries and I could only eat two, and that&#39;s not like me.  I tried to wipe off the salt, but they were still too salty to eat.  <br><br>All in all, this wasn&#39;t my favorite visit here.  Next time I&#39;ll stick with what I truly went there for - the cheesecake!

The first time I came here, I was blown away. The menu is huge, there are endless choices, and they really live up to the cheesecake part of the name with a wide selection of expensive slices. Unfortunately, they also live up the &#34;factory&#34; part of the name, which is really not a good thing. Their portions are generally large, which is sometimes a good thing, and other times you wonder how you are going to get rid of a plate full of subpar, bland food.<br><br>If you plan on drinking, make sure to ask for prices. They don&#39;t have a price list, but they will &#34;guess&#34; how much each drink is. Mixed drinks run around $10 and up (and aren&#39;t very impressive), and beer runs around $5. Happy hour is only at the bar. <br><br>I also feel it&#39;s my civic duty to warn any non-meat eaters: STAY AWAY! I have had meat in my meatless dishes not once, not twice, but THREE TIMES. Each time, staff was apathetic. The first time, there was chicken (small shreds, everywhere, so at first it wasn&#39;t completely apparent) in a non-chicken fettuccine. The manager came over and said, &#34;oh, well, someone in the kitchen must have used the same tongs for chicken as they did for the pasta.&#34; Basically, he shrugged it off, didn&#39;t offer to replace our dinner OR compensate us, and said, NO BIG DEAL. JUST CROSS-CONTAMINATION IN OUR KITCHEN. <br>Actually, it is a big deal, and it literally made me sick. I had to email the company and they gave me a gift card, which I used to buy their portabella and zucchini fries. Nearing the bottom of the batch, I poured them out and found, guess what? FRIED CHICKEN SKIN. I gave one to a meat-eating friend to verify, and she said it was definitely chicken. I had to stop there and laugh, but I also quickly got the check and got the hell out.<br><br>I really want to love this place. It has so much potential, but between the apathetic staff, the long waits, and the subpar food, there isn&#39;t a whole lot to love. Not to mention the whole cross-contamination problem, which for some reason doesn&#39;t seem to phase the managers or servers.<br><br>To be honest, the only saving grace of this place is their bread baskets. Seriously, so good, and so far I haven&#39;t found any meat lurking at the bottom.

I&#39;ve never had a bad meal here. Love the bread they serve before the meals. The Skinnylicious meals are really good, lower in calories, yet filling. The avocado spring rolls for Happy Hour are great. Love their White Chicken Chili, Bang Bang Shrimp and their Mouse Chocolate cheesecake. So yummy. Really can&#39;t have sugar any more, but if you like lemonade, try their raspberry lemonade (refillable) on a really hot day. It&#39;s nice that they have an outdoor patio, too.

Curbside pickup to go service is horrible! I love the food at the CCF. Decided to try their curbside to go since we had two kids in the car and couldn&#39;t wait for an hour for table service. I called them an hour in advance to put in my order. It rang 100 times with no answer. Called back, same thing. Called back again,she picked up and said &#34;let me transfer you to the bakery&#34;. Then it rang another 100 times with no answer. Called again, finally got someone. Placed the order for an hour later. When we arrived at the exact appointed time, I called the special number again with no answer! Called again as I was angrily walking inside to get the order myself, then someone finally picked up. They told me my order wouldn&#39;t be ready for another 5-10 minutes! Aaarrrgg! I may give this another shot and hope it&#39;s just a fluke but be forewarned.

Sigh.  Yes, the cheesecake factory has the largest menu in the Twin Cities.  It is probably a great spot to go if you have a group of people that all want different cuisine.  You can get breakfast, Mexican, Asian, burgers, and pasta all at the same place.  However, the food is only okay.  And the wait is worse!  They do not take reservations and the wait times are crazy.  Furthermore, I have never had good luck with the hostesses.  They always seem really annoyed to be working that particular day.  <br><br>I will not deny that the cheesecake is huge.  They do have a take-out counter specifically for the cheesecake.  I say use that counter if you must and otherwise try to avoid the wait times here.  There are so many other unique and delicious spots in the Twin Cities - go to these spots!
Never had a bad meal at a Cheesecake Factory.    Quality food at a reasonable price and good service.

I didn&#39;t realize the big menu and took me awhile to read through the ingredients. Finally settled with Cajun Jambalaya Pasta. I don&#39;t think I am ordering that again, nothing wow about it. My friend had spicy cashew chicken which was good but still plain. I have been there few times but I love their cheesecakes, they don&#39;t fail to amaze me.

I love The Cheesecake Factory, I absolutely love it.. BUT--I hate that it is a 50-50 chance that i will get bad service when I go. I have never gone twice in a row and had good service both times... NEVER.<br><br>This visit the waitress just seemed to be sidetracked. I dont know if she was close to getting off or what, (or maybe she was just an airhead) but we had to repeat EVERYTHING we said, because she was never paying attention. I asked her if the Mac and Cheese was baked, she didnt know, so i told her that if it was, and if it came with Bacon (because it usually does when its baked) to leave the bacon off.<br><br>10-15 minutes later, a chef brings me out Mac and cheese.. and annouces they removed the &#34;breadcrumbs&#34; as i requested!! What? no, no i wanted my breadcrumbs!!! <br><br>At this point i was so hungry i was just like screw it, so i didnt even ask if they could fix it. I just hate going here not knowing what/who i will get. And its the only one in the tri state area i think, so im out of other options when it comes down to it
Excellent quick bite to eat. Awesome food and excellent service.  We had an app, two small plates dining in and cheesecake to go!

PLEASE READ: AN HONEST AND IMPORTANT REVIEW!!!!<br>I have never, in all my years, had as horrible of an experience in a restaurant as today. The female manger was completely rude and unprofessional and our food arrived far beyond late. I live in California and came to Minnesota to spend the holidays with my family. Needless to say, our time was rather precious, so imagine our huge disappointment with the atrocious service we received. Sit tight because there is quite a story to tell! First off, our server was a really nice guy, but he did put in the order for our appetizers late. We get it, it&#39;s New Year&#39;s Day, it&#39;s going to be crowded, but after waiting for an hour to get our table, we were not expecting this.  Even with the late order, the appetizers arrived exactly 50 minutes after ordering. Our appetizers not only took this long, but came one by one! Our first appetizer (the avocado egg rolls) was brought by a man who, after hearing about how long we waited, rudely responded by saying &#34;do you want it or not&#34;. Our appetizers soon followed after 2 hours dedicated all to this restaurant. Oh yeah, the food! The two tables sitting next to us all received their food even after coming at least twenty minutes after us. One of our family members had to leave because he had to work!!! Our food came and it was fine, but at this point, we lost our appetite honestly. The manger, Jennifer, was INCREDIBLY RUDE. She took two appetizers off out of an order from a group of seven people and made far too many rude comments. She said that she would take care of the food of my family member, but we didn&#39;t realize she would take it off completely! When we asked to order it, she said that she would have to charge us. Really?!? He left because we had waited far more than an hour, and know we have to pay?! At this point, we were livid and wished to speak to the general manager. As Jennifer left, she said that she had been here for 12 years and was experienced for the job. She has been here for 12 years; that doesn&#39;t mean they were good years! Absolutely horrible. Anyway, in short, the general manager came, but none of the &#34;reductions&#34; could fix this horrible experience. I will certainly be contacting the main facility as this was beyond absurd. The food was fine, but the process to get it was beyond crazy. The manager was absolutely rude and the length for food arrival was absurd. On a side note, the general manger was nice (he came after Jennifer) and did compensate us, but like I said, this was a horrible evening all together!

Ugh. Why did we wait so long for that? It&#39;s not that good, and tonight it was downright bad. We arrived at 4:30 on a Saturday. We were told 20 minute wait but it was more like 45 minutes. When we were seated, our server was surly. I asked if they served orange soda and she curtly said &#34;no&#34; and stared at me. Also, they only have three beers on tap! What kind of place with millions of choices has so few taps? Bizarre. I ordered gumbo and it was very disappointing--chicken and shrimp very dry and over cooked. Lots of tasteless chunks of tomato. Blah. I could have made that at home. My husband had some kind of chicken and shrimp stir fry that had way too much pineapple. He had his leftovers packed to take home. He forgot his food on the table and ran back to get it. Well, he said it was utter chaos inside and his food was gone even though the rest of the table hadn&#39;t been bused. We won&#39;t be back.

Oh my god all I can say is portion size and menu!!!  It took me more than 30 minutes to get through the menu and then I had no clue what I wanted.  Its massive - review it online ahead of time.<br><br>The food when it arrived was ginormous.  I swear that the two entrees we ordered would have served up to six family members.  I got a chicken parmesan sandwich and it was so large that it seemed like six sandwiches in one.  The other speciality dish had four chicken breasts!!! If you go, do not order more than one entree for two people.  If you are big, then go for it.<br><br>Also, please please try the red velvet cheesecake.  If there is a heaven then it is that cake.  You may reach heaven soon after eating it too, but it was amazing.<br><br>I will likely not go again as it is not my type of place.  But for the cheesecake I will be back.

Food was adequate, but certainly not worth the wait of over an hour. The waitress deliberately avoided our table once she saw others seated after us getting their food, and then later came over and provided a lengthy and overly complicated story of how the kitchen staff was being finicky and our food still wasn&#39;t ready because &#34;You know how they are.&#34;  She was awful. The management staff was incredibly awkward and unapologetic.
they have take out!!!  Great food/desserts mighty powerful Godiva choc. cheesecake. I have sent many fo experience this great place!  The people make it an extra special experience ty!!!
The pasta are nice. My friends took steaks and they finish it flawlessly so its good. The staff are very nice but it took long timw to cook the dinner. Outside placr are quite a lot of flies.
The portions are obscenely large and the food is flavorless.  The cheesecake is very fatty and bland also.  And the dining room is rather chaotic.

The Cheesecake Factory USED TO BE a great place to eat.  We loved the large portions, great food, and cool atmosphere.  The decor was fun to look at.  The service was very good and snappy.  The food was simply delicious.  <br><br>But in the last 3 years; my husband and I have been watching this restaurant go downhill in its cleanliness dept. My husband, my daughter and I went back last night 6/28/13 in hopes &#34;maybe&#34; they have pulled it together but, nope... it&#39;s become worse. <br><br>We were seated and could not help but notice (from sliding) that the floors were filthy and greasy, the tables and booths same thing (food dropped from someone previous down below our table) and that&#39;s when we really started to check things out... The drinking glasses were even dirty! <br><br>They brought our food out all at separate times, gave me the wrong Ribeye steak (dry/over-cooked) and by the time we were done; we decided that it will be our very last time at the Cheesecake Factory which is sad because we used to LOVE this place.<br><br>I am sorry, but Mc D&#39;s is cleaner then this place and if I am going to pay a pretty penny to eat out at a semi-fancy restaurant, I want to know that the cleanness is priority on their list. If this is how the outer part of the restaurant looks, I sure don&#39;t even want to imagine what their kitchen looks like.

I only gave this place 2 stars because the cheesecake isn&#39;t the worst that I&#39;ve had. I have had better, even made better. Let&#39;s start from the top and work our way to the desert. Waited maybe 20 minutes, which was a relatively short time compared to other places (which were way better to eat at) that I have been to. Sat down and started looking over the long menu of 200 something items. I&#39;ll stop you at this point, that&#39;s a list of 200 disappointments to choose from. While everyone in our group had something different, not a single person was impressed with their meal. Ordered a couple of things to try off the snacks/sides/appetizer sections of the menu. Was not impressed really with ANY of it. Placed our main order in and half of the table&#39;s order came out. Waited several minutes before our waiter realized that only half the table got their order. Waited a few more minutes to get our plates. I had the bacon-bacon cheeseburger. There&#39;s nothing I love more than a good classic. This was the complete opposite. Bacon was BURNT to a black strip of what had appeared to be bacon. I almost cried for the bacon abuse! Started conversing with everyone else and their thoughts about their meal. Not a single dish was really worth the cost nor taking more than a couple of bites worth and feeling sick. Fries were salty as BLEEP! Had a glob of what appeared to be the 2 different cheeses on top of my burger. The special sauce really isn&#39;t a sauce, but more like some random ingredients pureed to a disgusting blob on the bottom of my burger. Everyone pushed their plates aside and waited, for what seemed like an eternity for our waiter to return. Ordered some deserts and was hoping at this time in the night that our horrid experience would make a turn for the better. Was let down yet again, and wasn&#39;t surprised. A hot fudge brownie sundae was ordered, was nothing more than some mere few pieces of brownie (that tasted old) and ice cream with-get this-Hershey&#39;s chocolate syrup that was cold served up. Whip cream? More like whipped milk! Even their so called famous cheesecakes were a joke! Over sugary, old, hard as a rock icing, thrown together mess of a desert better describes it! I would have had better chances eating at Chipotle&#39;s and chance getting Ebola or salmonella than going back to this place!

I&#39;ve been a fan since 1990, but, this time was slightly disappointing for me.  I had the Sunday Brunch Green chile carna(something or other).  The pork was extremely dry and the tortilla chips were all soggy when the dish arrived at my table.  I was hungry so I ate a bit of it and decided to just save room for the good stuff!  I had the Adams special cheesecake (Peanut butter cups/Butterfinger/OMG).<br><br>The waitress was super sweet, attentive and got a nice tip out of it!

Was here many times before and this is the first time that the food both for my grandchild and for myself was barely ok.  I had fish and chips and both were meh warm.  I&#39;m used to hot, right off the stove quality.  My grandson had hamburger and fries and they too were just warm, same quality. Both as if they had been sitting for awhile. I went Wednesday.  Disappointed. :(
OK better server, still good food and finally got to try the Godiva Chocolate cheesecake, it was worth all the guilt people get around food.  We will come back another time

I&#39;ve been to the Cheesecake Factory several times before.  However, the waitress was one of the best ones I&#39;ve ever had there.  She didn&#39;t look sideways at the fact my boyfriend and I were giving each other sex lorn looks amidst the Egyptian/Greek/Harem decor.  Being on the road can make one horny.  Just ask any truck driver.  Also, my boyfriend did a magic trick I had never seen in my life.  He made a salt shaker disappear, and then reappear later that night where the sun doesn&#39;t shine for me.  It was also the longest magic trick ever.  I got a little jealous because I wondered what else he hides from me.

My mother and I stopped in for an early dinner recently. Both hosts were very pleasant and greeted us with a smile. I was pleased we only waited about 5 minutes for a table (although even if we had waited longer, it&#39;s not the businesses fault that they are popular!). Our waiter was James F. He was extremely nice and prompt when we needed something. He had the perfect server personality, charming but not so charming that you can tell it&#39;s fake. He seemed genuinely concerned with making sure we were taken care of and enjoying our meals. The drinks from the bar were excellent and beautifully presented (they used all fresh mint, fruit, etc.). Food was great, including the pumpernickel bread or whatever it was that came free. We got the Cobb salad as an appetizer. The vinaigrette dressing was light but still flavorful and the avocado was soft and ripe. Will definitely order it next time. The cheesecake we took home was also bomb! One thing I appreciated was that we were there for almost 2.5 hours and James never made us feel like he was in a hurry for us to get out of there. I&#39;ve worked in the service industry for a long time and understand the pain when tables &#34;camp out&#34; in your section. I even apologized to him but he assured us that we can stay as long as we want. Granted we did continue to order drinks and dessert so it&#39;s not like we were sitting there sipping waters for an hour or anything. I briefly chatted with someone who i assume was a manger of some sort, and he was very personable and outgoing. Overall I was super impressed with our experience! I was shocked to see The Cheesecake Factory only had 3 stars on Yelp, so I wanted to be sure to leave a review. The only thing that i was less than impressed with were the bathrooms. It was a bit unkept and most stalls were out of toilet paper (something that&#39;s understandable at 7:30pm mid dinner rush, but like I said it was like 4-5ish). I will definitely be back and will probably request James F!

very good food and service despite how busy it was.  we waited an hour even tho they said itd be almost two. had the biscuits and gravy and it was amazing comfort food.  one could have fed two of us though!! yum!

This place is a gold mine. It&#39;s alway busy and the wait is always 20-30 minutes. If your prepared for that then fine..if not..your experience will not be the same. I think there menu is way to large with way to many choices...but when you get the food...all is well. Wait staff at times can be very inattentive and overwhelmed with the number of tables they serve. I&#39;d go back, but at an earlier time of the day.

Great restaurant, great service, and great food!<br><br>Everything on their menu has been awesome that I have tried, particularly their burgers and fish and chips. The burgers are cooked perfectly and had great toppings on them, my personal favorites are the mac and cheese burger and the americana burger.... their BBQ ranch sauce is awesome as well! <br><br>Cheesecakes: gotta try the red velvet and the white chocolate blueberry..... oh and also the caramel apple streusel!<br><br>Service was fantastic, the two waitresses I had were Brittany and Kelsey and they were both very friendly, helpful, and attentive.<br><br>Overall, probably my favorite restaurant I have ever eaten at.

Came here for dinner on a Saturday evening in July. They quoted a 45 min wait time, but we were seated in about 20 mins. Waiter was friendly and very efficient. Love their bread-- definitely one of the highlights of coming here. Split a pasta with my mom, hubby got the Cajun pasta and I snuck many bites of mac and cheese from my 6 yr old&#39;s bowl. Ordered a couple of slices of cheesecake to share for dessert and we had enough to bring some home. Had the s&#39;mores cheesecake (soooooo sinful) and the traditional fresh strawberry cheesecake. Overall, a good experience at this chain restaurant.

The food is delicious and the staff are generally nice. We noticed that they don&#39;t employ only young kids which is a nice change. The older waitress we had was fantastic. Very polite and engaging. The food was so good and then choices were endless. Ive been there twice and have yet to be disappointed with my choices. The only problem..which isn&#39;t really much of a problem is that they don&#39;t have WiFi.

Their menu has everything. You have a friend that only eats pasta and one that only eats burgers and one that only eats eggs? Cool, go to The Cheesecake Factory! However, you probably shouldn&#39;t go if you have a friend that doesn&#39;t eat meat, because some might sneak in, no matter what they order... Also don&#39;t plan on coming here for drinks unless you have A LOT of money to spend, because they will not give you the prices.

We were sat within 5 minutes which is quick for a table of 6. We had two small children with us, and we had to ask our server for the children&#39;s menu rather than him asking us if we needed children&#39;s menus. The food was alright but nothing outstanding. The cheesecake was delicious as always.

I ordered the pear and endive salad with NO blue cheese to pick up. When I got home it had blue cheese all over it. My husband drove back to get a new salad with no blue cheese. I was so disappointed. The chicken was cold and tasted like it was out of a can and the pears were soggy and also out of a can.  I can&#39;t believe I not only paid for this but drove twice to get. Horrible job Cheesecake Factory
Mmmmmmmmmm.   Very tasty.  Good service.   The kids were all over it.   We all had pasta.  So good!  And yummy warm bread before our meal. Tasty!!!!

Food is generally good, portions are HUGE so plan to either be super full, have leftovers, or share a dish between 2 (or 3) people!  The happy hour is amazing though!  Tons of great food dishes for $5 as well as drinks and beer specials.  Love it!  I get super full for $10.

If I want to be sure I really enjoy everything about my meal and my experience I go here. I don&#39;t even hesitate to bring friends and family because I am confident it will be terrific.  Why only 4 stars?  Almost always a ridiculous wait, they took my favorite dish off the menu, the portions are extreme. Pretty small list compared to all the things they&#39;ve done fabulously every time I have visited.

I enjoy cheesecake and I can always get a good piece from the Cheesecake Factory.   The menu is HUGE but each item I&#39;ve ever tried I really like.  I recently had the Skinny Shrimp Tacos and they were A+++ w/a little spice :)<br><br>My server was knowledgeable and friendly!  Her recommendation on the Asian Pear Martini was stellar! <br><br>Because it&#39;s located in the mall, you have to deal with mall parking.

Went for late dinner (after 9pm).  Hostess was welcoming and friendly.  I sat at booth in bar area.  Server (Amber) was attentive, and order was prompt and accurate.  Food was very good and drink was refilled before running out.  Bill was brought at appropriate time and was quickly processed.  Great experience, no complaints.

I refuse to write a review about the White Chocolate Caramel Macadamia Nut Cheesecake<br><br>Or the Mango-Key Lime Cheesecake<br>Or the Lemoncello Cream Torte<br>Or the Red Velvet Cheesecake<br>Or the Warm Apple Crisp<br>Or the Strawberry Shortcake<br>Or the Black-Out Cake <br>Or the Kahlua® Cocoa Coffee Cheesecake<br>Or the Pumpkin Pecan Cheesecake<br><br>Doing so would be like admitting I&#39;ve tried every single one of these desserts....and that&#39;s just not going to happen (again!) - bbuuuuurrrrrp!

The food is always on par! They try to do the best they can to feed a person with quality 5 star food. The seating issue and not having a reservation system at all times is ridiculous and such a cry for help for a restaurant that has maybe 100 tables and is one level unlike most Cheesecake Factory restaurants. They have people waiting for an hour or two for a table when they wouldn&#39;t have angry customers if they did reservations. For a restaurant that is as popular as it is and has the patronage that it does, it does not go anywhere near 5 stars on seating and wait times. And their hosts or hostesses are horrible at giving good time frames according to tables leaving and such. For the Twin Cities Cheesecake Factory, they have two issues that need to be resolved...a fully active reservation system with better seating arrangement with the strong thought of expanding! Also, either expanding the one restaurant or building one or two more in a metropolitan area this size!

Absolutely my favorite place! I had my bday there many years ago. I love all their appetizers! Amazing cheesecake! I know they don&#39;t take reservations after a certain time on weekdays or weekends....i waited for an an hour one time and i didnt mind at all because i was craving for their food! They have the best long island!

I am almost embarrassed to say that I really enjoyed my experience eating at the Cheesecake Factory. I ordered a Southwestern salad, and it was really good. <br><br>That said, lower your prices, you are The Cheesecake Factory, and $8 for one slice of semi-decent cheesecake is highway robbery. Also, $9 for my glass of Sangria? You are The Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>So much botox in this place that I felt I like I got botox by association.

The portion sizes here are insane. You could feel your whole family with one dish. Instead of a menu they give you a book. Anything you can think of they probably serve, but its all pretty lame and over-priced.<br>The decor is hideous. Some things look like they are trying to be Egyptian, other things look kind of Roman, and the light fixtures look like the eye from Lord of the Rings. Maybe they wanted the design to match the menu- lots of random stuff thrown together but none of it done particularly well. <br>All dinner I was looking forward to the cheesecake. Since its in the name I figured it had to be good. I went with the classic cheesecake with strawberries on top. It was ok but nothing to write home about. <br>To be fair, I&#39;m not a big fan of huge chain restaurants so if thats your thing you may like it here. I for one won&#39;t be back.

I wasn&#39;t very excited to try this place, but I wondered what all the rage was about.  When I got to the restaurant we were asked to wait 2.5 hours!  Seriously? Who in their right mind would wait 2.5 hours to eat food that is off a Sysco truck? Ok I&#39;m a snob, I like food that is fresh, in season, and local,  so I waited for awhile to see if a table would open up. Meanwhile I got to watch some poor girl put whip cream on nearly 30,000 cheesecakes.  I wondered if this girl would ever eat cheesecake again? Then I wondered if these cheesecakes were made on location or if it came frozen from some factory thousands of miles away? All I could wonder is why would someone be asked to wait 2.5 hours?  The greeters at the door seemed nervous that the angry hungry people waiting might create an uprising.   <br><br>Sadly enough I couldn&#39;t wait 2.5 hours.  I left.

I can&#39;t even believe I went here. <br><br>I was at the movies with some friends and we wanted lunch. Walked in around 1:30ish on a Saturday, it was very quiet. <br><br>I hadn&#39;t been there in years and now I know why - to me, it&#39;s nothing special. I wonder who would wait for a while to get a table, but then I realized it takes so long to even get a grasp on the menu. <br><br>We were seated at a fairly large table, which was good and we ordered some drinks, which came fairly quick. What isn&#39;t quick is trying to decide what to have. The damn menu is just too big! Do I want a regular sized salad, an appetizer size salad, or a salad and something combo? Do I want an appetizer or a small plate? Ahhh. Too many decisions. <br><br>I settled on a Coors Light, a small arugula salad, and a sausage and ricotta pizette. Our group ordered various items and I can say for sure, the fried mac and cheese balls (I know, what am I eating those for?) with marinara were the best thing we had. I had 1/4 of the large ball and that was enough. My salad and pizette were the perfect size for me considering the pizza and salad combo was gigantic. <br><br>My bill was around $16 for the beer and snacks. I thought the price was fine, I guess I&#39;m just not crazy about the place. <br><br>The service was good, she was pleasant enough, but a little hover-y, the price was right, although I&#39;m not sure a Coors Light bottle should be $4.75, the menu too big and nothing is spectacular. I would not go back if given the choice. <br><br>PS - I don&#39;t really like cheesecake, so I didn&#39;t even try it,

Their corn cakes are delicious--flavorful and soothing at the same time.  My favorite dish here.  I actually craze it sometimes. I also have enjoyed their lettuce wraps.<br><br>Service on the slow side.

Disclaimer: I have never liked the food at the Cheesecake Factory, and I&#39;ve eaten at locations in Raleigh, DC, Atlanta, Milwaukee and now, Edina. My sister wanted cheesecake for her birthday, so I&#39;ll admit I was dragged to this dinner.  I went in with low expectations, but hoping to be pleasantly surprised. It&#39;s been a few years since I&#39;ve been to a Cheesecake Factory... <br><br>The decor is nice, the booths comfortable, the hostess stand was well organized, the cheesecakes in the case looked appealing, and the place was so busy on a Tuesday night I figured it couldn&#39;t be that bad.<br><br>Then I looked at the menu. First warning sign: It&#39;s about 20 pages long. If the menu is unfocused, the kitchen is unfocused. That tells me they do a mediocre job on a variety of things - a little bit of Asian fusion, a little Tex-Mex, alongside burgers, seafood and steak. Second, the prices are high for what you&#39;re getting. Sure, the portions are large, so there&#39;s a high perceived value, but do we really need to stuff our faces? I&#39;d rather be given the option to order half portions or simply go to a better restaurant and get quality food for my money.<br><br>Ahi Tartare: small dices of tuna on avocado, plated in a ring mold and served with 4 crispy wontons and pickled ginger. Totally unoriginal, but the flavors were good.  However, the avocado was cut in huge unwieldy chunks, rather than diced the same as the tuna. I&#39;m not just nit-picking on an aesthetic point. It makes eating the dish easier, and shows attention to detail on the part of the kitchen. This looked like someone scooped avocado chunks from the sandwich bar.<br><br>Beets with Goat Cheese: not enough beets, not enough goat cheese. The candied pecans were good.<br><br>Crispy Chicken Taquitos: bland, bland, crispy, bland. And I don&#39;t even like that much salt. The salsa was bland; the guacamole was bland. <br><br>Wild Mushroom Soup: I liked the large chunks of mushroom, and even though it was a little on the salty side for me, it was very creamy and tasty. It was too thick, though. I ordered soup, not porridge. <br><br>Chocolate-Raspberry Truffle Cheesecake: disappointing. There was a vague aroma of raspberry liquor, but no actual fruit or raspberry glaze or sauce to provide the necessary tart, fruity tang to balance out the overwhelming creaminess of the chocolate cheesecake.  <br><br>I used to think Cheesecake Factory had fine cheesecake and bad food. Now I just don&#39;t understand the appeal at all. However, every location I&#39;ve ever been to has always been hopping, there&#39;s always a wait, and apparently people are willing to pay their outrageous prices, so there must be something I just don&#39;t get.  The only time I&#39;ll ever go back to a Cheesecake Factory is if someone else is paying.
Love their menu.  Everything we have had has been good and consistent.  Even when its busy we can usually sit at the bar.
This place was hoppin&#39; at 9:30 pm on Saturday! We had a 20 minute wait but it was worth it! Large portions and delicious food. Took cheesecake to go. Yum!

So I am reviewing this location because it was the last one I went to.. but obviously this is a chain restaurant and it seems to be about the same everywhere I go.<br><br>What I like <br>- Nice decor.. not so fancy that you can&#39;t dress casual.. but not so casual that you feel strange if you look a little dressy.<br>- The classic cheesecake with strawberries is amazing<br>- I have always had decent service here<br>- The menu is extensive<br><br>What I don&#39;t like<br>- I STILL after being here more than 10 times have not found a dish that I love. I have tried something new almost every time. The food has been consistently mediocre.

Oh my... My mouth is watering JUST by thinking of the Cheesecake variety here! Well, after all, it is The Cheesecake Factory!<br><br>The times that I have been here, I have wanted to try something new... Because if you look at the menu, there are pages of delicious cheesecake for your taste buds to enjoy! That being said, I have stirred from my goal a few times... I have had Linda&#39;s Fudge Cake about 3 times. Whoops! But it is just SO good! And the last time I went there, I had the Chocolate Tower Truffle Cake. The slice was so big, I had to take it home! And found a couple hours later that my entire family thought it was delicious, too! My advice to those who do NOT want to share: Order, eat as much as you can, bring it home, and HIDE it very well in the refrigerator!!!<br><br>Cheesecake Factory, you know how to bring a hungry customer back for more!

Way to expensive! $8 for a slice. Cafe latte in St. Paul has better taste and half the price!  Slow service, ordered 2 slices to go and wAited over 30 minutes to get served.  Should of went to Cossettas....

Not original and kinda cheesy.  Everything about this place screams - over fed, over indulgent Americans.   <br><br>Menu gave you way too many choices.  How can a kitchen be good at THAT many dishes?  Food was HUGE, too sweet, and too salty.<br><br>Best thing was the service.

Dined here on 12/31/2012, for my BF&#39;s birthday! <br>-During lunch hour- Busy but took about 7 mins for drinks to be served and 30 mins for the entrees to come out, decent timing for service<br>-The BF ordered the  over the top meatloaf sandwich and I ordered Evelyn&#39;s favorite Pasta<br>-Food: Evelyn&#39;s Fav Pasta consist of Penne Tossed with Broccoli, Oven-Dried Tomato, Roasted Eggplant, Peppers, Artichoke, Kalamata Olives, Garlic and Pine Nuts. <br>Penne Pasta was very dry! It was so clumped together..Broccoli over-cooked, Artichoke was not fresh (chef claimed to be fresh, taste like canned) and Roasted eggplant was not cooked all the way through<br>lol..I am no Chef Ramsey but I love food and I want food to taste like it should...<br>I received my entree and took a bite and I was disgusted, but did not want to complain to the waitress because she seemed to be having a rough day but she was really nice, waitress saw my reaction from afar and came to see what was the issue and offered to bring it back and bring out a new order but the BF and I was on a time crunch and said no thanks, minutes later ASSHOLE manager comes and tell me, &#34;Ma&#39;am, I heard you don&#39;t like your entree? Now let me tell you something, I am willing to bring out you a new entree because NO MATTER WHAT, I AM GOING TO MAKE YOU PAY FOR YOUR MEAL or I can give you two slices of cheesecake on the house&#34; What an asshole, I was NOT looking for a free meal nor did I complain to the waitress about how dry my pasta was and how disgusting the dish was! Then I told the manager no thanks i&#39;m in a hurry, I appreciated but if you insist I will take a house salad with vinaigrette dressing...10 mins later the same waitress comes back with the salad and APOLOGIZES for her RUDE MANAGERS behavior! <br>I will def come back if I get the same waitress but as for the ASSHOLE manager no thanks! I feel bad that she haves to work for someone like that! <br>Overall, Food was not great but will come back again to give them a redeeming chance, Service was great minus D-BAG manager.

If you can look past the over zealous Stepford wifes eating what they think is fine dinning its not that bad of a place.<br>Consider a sports bar without the TVs in every nook and cranny, throw some gouda cheese on the burger rather then American, dress the waitresses in white, hike up the price and you have The Cheesecake Factory. (if you don&#39;t tip here, but tip at the sports bar, its the same price)<br><br>Its good for what it is, the price isn&#39;t the best, but they have a huge selection of entree&#39;s guaranteed to please everyone!

My friends and I came here on a Saturday night for our friends birthday dinner, and they told us that we would have an hour and a half wait, which we were fine with! As we waited about an hour in we asked how long and they said &#34;we were next&#34; so it would be about 20 minutes. We saw 3 groups our size get seated in front of us, we asked and they said sorry you&#39;re next. Saw more get seated and looked at the time and it was 2 hours and 15 minutes later. This was unacceptable service and I was really excited to finally try your food that I heard good things about, but after this night I&#39;m very disappointed and won&#39;t be back anytime soon. Horrible service.

Been here twice. Food is delicious, service was okay, price hurt my wallet.<br><br>Had standard food like the filet mignon, chicken alfredo, salmon, lasagna, mozzarella sticks.<br><br>The filet mignon was the best I ever had. I would go again.

I only ate there once, and I enjoyed it very much! But I mostly do cheesecake to-go line. And I always enjoy buying it from them, the staff&#39;s are wonderful at the register. So I can&#39;t say more about the food area, but I know that the line is a long Waite.

I&#39;ve always loved Cheesecake for a variety of reasons, mostly the food:<br><br>1. the soup and salad combo<br>2. the lettuce wraps!<br>3. steaaaakssss and shrimp<br>4. the piece of cheesecake i can never finish<br>5. the flying gorilla of course, extra liquor plsss<br>6. the brown bread WITH butter, mmm i love bread<br><br>the only sad part about this rating is the service my friends and i experienced at the Edina location on a Wednesday night. sad sad sad... it took an hour to get a table (which is fine, I guess, because we had a big group), but the fact that we found empty tables EVERYWHERE as we were walking to our table. what happened there? i don&#39;t know. and the time it took for the lady to take our orders? aye.... sorry Cheesecake, you&#39;re gona have to deal with my 2/5 rating for this one.

Eh.  The cheesecake was good, we had the Turtle sunday cheesecake and it was really very creamy and nice. but expensive $7 for a slice.<br><br>My boyfriend and i each had a salad, he enjoyed his (a spicy chicken avacado ranch salad)  I had a low cal salad with blue cheese, there was plenty of blue cheese (which suprised me) but i dont eat chicken so i substituted shrimp.  i got 4 shrimp, and they upcharged me $4!!!!.<br><br>It&#39;s a chain and i didnt expect to be WOW&#39;ed.

First Time I ever ate at the Cheesecake Factory was in Scottsdale Arizona (next to my hotel).  Well I could see the appeal immediately.<br><br>The only thing I ever order is the Chicken Madeira....it&#39;s magical and addicting...can never eat the whole dish (and soooo excited for the left overs).<br><br>Just like a bar cashs in on drinks, this place must subsidize it&#39;s self with the cheesecake bill.  I&#39;m not a cheesecake lover at all, but the godiva chocolate cheescake can send anyone to heaven.

THE BEST chocolate cake anywhere (blackout cake).  We have had some stellar meals here, and a few screwy ones.  Overall, it&#39;s a favorite for &#34;special&#34; meals.  It&#39;s HUGE....but still be prepared to wait.

Lots of Choices;Lots of customers! Food was okay. Like the healthy salad options. Sent fries back because they were so salty we couldn&#39;t eat them. Took forever to get a new order. Would love to see vegan cheesecake offered made with cashews. Most food has cheese or cow&#39;s milk or cheese involved, so if you are dairy intolerant or allergic, it is challenging to find a food choice.
Food was OK, but service was very bad. I would not recommend unless you wanted to buy cheesecakes.

I had the cajun jambalaya pasta which was a phenomenal entree and for a desert the red velvet cheesecake was delicious as usual.  My favorite appetizer from any restaurant is the chicken lettuce wraps with the peanut sauce!!!<br><br>I highly recommend this restaurant

Worst lunch experience ever!  Taking my family out for my daughters birthday.  Two meals out of four were brought out. 10 minutes later the third. My wife&#39;s lunch never arrived. The waitress apologized but was unable to get her lunch. I spoke to the manager about it and after another 15 minutes he brought her lunch. When we told him to just box it up since we were out of time, he gave an eye roll which was even more irritating. Will not EVER go back to this place.  JG

Great dinner overall.<br><br>Was busy as usual so we opted for the lounge.  We couldnt wait for food (starving) so I got a chocolate milk from the bartender.  Very willing to help my quasi diabetic request..lol.  Got a table in the lounge in 5 mins.  Server was friendly, knowledgable, and helpful.<br><br>Rib-eye - ~13oz.  Rare.  Cooked perfect.  Great seasoning.  Good size.  Subbed out the fries for mashed.  Great mashed potatoes as I dont normally like mashed.<br><br>Hibachi Steak - Cooked perfect.  Great marinade.<br><br>Cheesecake was amazing as always.

It&#39;s a Cheesecake Factory. If you&#39;ve never been to one, the menu is a bit intimidating with its large selection, but I enjoy this restaurant. The service has been consistently good. The portions are large, so you&#39;ll either be having leftovers or sharing. The food is pretty tasty and of course, you probably should have dessert if you are treating yourself to this restaurant anyway.

This was one of my favorite places to go when I lived closer to one in Arizona, but it&#39;s worth the occasional jaunt down to Edina just for lunch.  <br><br>As a vegetarian it&#39;s rare that I look at a menu at a national chain and have a hard time picking what I want; there&#39;s usually only 2-3 items to choose from.  But The Cheesecake Factory is different.  First off, their menu is a book....literally.  Granted it has plenty of ads, but there&#39;s a lot of food to choose from regardless of your dietary preferences!<br><br>My personal favorites are the avocado egg rolls and the grilled portobello on a bun, but be careful when you order.  Unless you can EAT, it&#39;s hard to get through an appetizer and an entree, even when sharing.  Portions are large and filling!<br><br>One of the things that stands out about The Cheesecake Factory is actually just a little thing that means a lot to me.  Anyone that dines out with children knows that the most stressful time is the time between sitting down at the table and the point at which the food arrives.  Kids tend to get restless during this time and chaos can ensue (which is why Mexican food, with chips and salsa, is always a good option with kids!).  The Cheesecake Factory solves this problem by bringing out a small plate with some banana, orange and Cheerios that the kids immediately latch on to.  It&#39;s a great idea that is most appreciated by those of us with kids, not to mention those sitting nearby that might get some peace and quiet.<br><br>And of course there&#39;s the cheesecake.  The only bad thing you can say about the cheesecake is that it&#39;s just too rich.  But that would be a stretch of a complaint!<br><br>There can long waits for lunch and dinner so plan on spending a little more time waiting, but I can assure you that the wait is worth it!

I like the Cheesecake Factory&#39;s food.  Everything is made to order (with a few exceptions, ie app rolls, goulash, and that&#39;s about it actually)<br><br>My favorites are: Cobb Salad, Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp, Miso Salmon, C&amp;A, Pesto Pizza, Thai Wraps, and Tamale Cakes.  There are more but I am too hungry right now to think about it.  :)  <br><br>Come in on a Saturday, the soup is the BEST: Cream of Chx with Artichoke Hearts and Mushrooms.  <br><br>Something most restaurants don&#39;t do:  You can sub anything for fries.  Yes that means a tossed salad that is normally 6.50, or mashed potatoes, or broc, or whatever..for the SAME price.  Killer!!   (asparagus is an upcharge, however, fyi)<br><br>Also, bro, sorry about your server not being attentive.  Boo on them.  <br><br>Yes it&#39;s a chain but if your idea of dining out is Applebee&#39;s *(don&#39;t laugh, there are a lot of people like that.  Why do you think AB&#39;s etc are still in business?) Come check it out for a nice dinner out<br><br>If you&#39;re a local dwelling-independent business type?  Go to eat street.  :)

The...Best...Cheesecake...Ever!  I seriously can&#39;t eat cheesecake from anywhere else.  Their cheesecake is so rich &amp; creamy, and you can choose from over like 50 flavors.  My mouth is watering just thinking about it!<br><br>The food is good, just expensive.  I love the Buffalo Blasts &amp; the Chicken Picatta!
Actually their pre-meal bread is awesome. :) Cheesecake of course. Pineapple one is good.

I had a normal dining experience here.  The food was good and service was fast.  I did not enjoy the $20 tab when I only got a coke and the lunch  pizza and salad combo.  <br><br>Let&#39;s talk about this combo though.  They claim it is a lunch combo, but it was huge portions.  I got the caesar salad and it was definitely a dinner sized salad.  If it would have had a protein on it, it could have been my whole meal.  Secondly, the pizza was very large for being a lunch size..  I won&#39;t complain about having left overs, but I was surprised by this.<br><br>The air conditioning was really cold and made the whole experience kind of uncomfortable.<br><br>Our server was very nice and attentive.

This is a standard &#34;dinner and a movie&#34; place for us, since it&#39;s right next to the Southdale theaters.<br><br>And if you want a ton of food, the Cheesecake Factory is the place to go.  I always leave completely stuffed, so stuffed that I hardly ever get to ordering any cheesecake! Tonight I got cream cheese crab wontons (yummy, but dipping sauce not my fave), and a burger. The burger had more muenster cheese than I&#39;ve *ever* seen on one piece of food, plus avocado and a nice, tart mustard sauce. It was excellent and so large I could hardly finish it.  Side salad with the burger was quite good too, although a little wilted from being &#34;drenched&#34; with dressing (but the dressing was good).<br><br>Usually, I get the &#34;small plate&#34; endive salad (yum!) except I like it with Ranch dressing more than the vinagrette it normally comes with.  Then, I&#39;ll order an appetizer like the avocado egrolls and call it a meal.

An all-American chain restaurant, but it is pretty good! Huge restaurant, with large bar area and ample booth and table seating. The portions are also very large, even the lunch portions! Lunch prices are a little on the high side (including tax and tip I spent $17 for a sandwich and side salad). The cheesecake is good, and lots of choices. There&#39;s nothing unique or different about te Cheesecake Factory, so if all you need is safe, stable, good food and service and to just go on a routine out to eat lunch/dinner, this will have you covered.

Love this place. I think it&#39;s the only one in the state (but i could be wrong). I wish i could tell you more about the other items on their menu unfortunately the first thing I had was their meatloaf and now i can&#39;t dare to try anything else when i&#39;m there. It&#39;s too damn good and i would feel like i&#39;m cheating on the meatloaf if i were to try anything else! <br><br>I did, however, try one of their appetitzers and the Avacodo Eggrolls were scrumptious. Wait...i did dig in on one of their delicious cheesecakes too. Though how can you choose which one? They have so many options it&#39;s hard to say which is the best. One thing to note: their portion sizes are crazy big. If i skip the app and dessert, i could finish the main course, but then i feel like exploding afterwards. Fun times!

I have eaten at this chain restaurant in many cities (Boston, Houston, LA,). this was the worst experience: my salad was so obviously not fresh (cucumbers should never be cut 2 days ahead of time!), the enchilada was cold, and my mom&#39;s filet mignon was just acceptable.<br>the cheesecake was just ok, nothing remarkable either.<br>of course, the service was slow
Still the best.  I was away on a business trip and when to my most favorite chain restaurant.  The service is consistent with any other Cheesecake Factory.

Say what you will about chain restaurants, but I like everything about The Cheesecake Factory and would tell anyone it&#39;s one of my favorite places to eat. The menu is extensive and varied with a lot of veggie options, the lunch combos are great, the food is fresh, the service has always been friendly and efficient, and the passion fruit iced tea is so good, I actually get cravings for it.<br><br>To start, you&#39;re given wonderful sour dough and brown bread and they are happy to provide olive oil instead of butter. The edamame appetizer ($4.95) is perfectly steamed and salted, and a good portion of pods. The avocado eggrolls ($9.95) are delicious and decadent with chunks of avocado, sun-dried tomato, red onion and cilantro in a crisp wrapper with a tamarind-cashew dipping sauce. If you eat shrimp, the Vietnamese shrimp summer rolls ($8.95) are as good as those I&#39;ve had in any authentic Asian restaurant. Also offered is guacamole made-to-order, sweet corn tamale cakes and a fire roasted artichoke with dipping sauce.<br><br>The appetizer salads are abundant, colorful, fresh and easily a meal by themselves. The tossed green salad ($6.95) is the perfect house salad with tomato wedges, sliced cucumber and julienned beet, zucchini and carrot. I highly recommend the peanut cilantro dressing, but the Asian plum dressing and balsamic vinaigrette are also very good. Also tasty is the French country salad ($8.95) with beets, grilled asparagus and pecans (can hold the goat cheese) and the vegetable chopped salad ($8.95) with edamame, green beans, asparagus, cucumber, tomato, roasted beets and apple in a pomegranate vinaigrette (can hold the white cheddar).<br><br>Lunch combos and portions are served every day until 5:00 p.m. and range from $7.95 to $10.95. My favorite is the roasted vegetable and goat cheese pizza with Japanese eggplant, artichoke, red and yellow pepper, Kalamata olives and tomato, paired with the tossed green salad. (Vegans, ask them to hold all the cheese on the pizza since there is parmesan in addition to goat cheese.) The Santa Fe entrée salad is simple southwestern goodness with greens, corn, black beans, tomato and tortilla strips in the spicy peanut-cilantro dressing ($9.95 for lunch portion; $13.95 for entrée size). You can hold the chicken and cheese and add avocado.<br><br>The grilled portabella on a bun ($10.95) is a huge mushroom cap flavored with herbs topped with lettuce, tomato and grilled red onion (can add avocado and hold the cheese and the spicy mayo) served with fries, or they happily substitute any side. The incredible grilled eggplant sandwich is also great - again, I recommend adding avocado if you hold the cheese and mayo. A number of nice vegetable sides are available including broccoli, corn succotash, asparagus, sautéed spinach and snow peas with veggies, ranging from $3.95 to $6.50.<br><br>Vegetarians can choose from more than 25 flavors of cheesecake and numerous other stunning desserts. There are no vegan dessert options, other than a pricey bowl of strawberries. The Cheesecake Factory is home away from home for my family as we&#39;ve been eating at the Southdale location in Edina at least once a month since they opened and we&#39;ve been to locations in other cities. Even after many visits, we&#39;ve yet to try all the veggie options available, we&#39;re always pleased with the staff&#39;s willingness to accommodate our veggie requests and we always look forward to our meals there knowing that we&#39;ll leave happy. <br><br>For more info: <a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.examiner.com%2Fx-10371-Minneapolis-Vegetarian-Examiner&amp;s=018da3a9f11c5aa68ae10ddc26678f195f88989155d7ce373fefc472a00f5d73" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">examiner.com/x-10371-Min…</a>

oh man. Am i ready to give Cheese Cake factory a review. *(cracking my knuckles)* <br>food was ok. Cakes were good. no complaints there. NOW... let me begin<br><br>halfway through our dinner with my loved one. the waiter comes over with a smerk on his face. i could tell he didnt want to be there by the look on his face. or maybe moms just dropped him on his face one to many times while watching Oprah with a pack of Full Flavored Kool 100&#39;s in one hand while juggling him and the bottle of Scotch in the other? so....... he comes over stares at me with a David hasselhof look and says anything else. We said No thank you. he reaches into his pocket and pulls out some sort of stick, leans up and over into my food and starts to sweep off some of the pepper that i accidently got on the table. Shocked with disbelief in my mind i was like WTF yo?!? he takes a step back, this time gives me a &#34;The Apprentice&#34; your FIRED!!! Donald Trump look and walks away with this peppered up glue stick in his hand. Seriously is this normal at the &#34;DontSpillAnyFreakinPepperOnYourTableOtherwiseYouG­etTheGlueStickCakeFactory&#34;    if it is then my apoliges. If not, Management seriously needs to hire and properly train their staff. <br><br>Zero Stars in my books.

It is 2014, and the Cheesecake Factory still doesn&#39;t have any sort of call ahead or reservation system.  I figured we would give them a try anyway- a group of 6 adults ready to have a nice dinner on a Saturday night.  I was ready for a 30-45min wait before being seated when we arrived at 6:45pm. However- the hostess told us it would be 60-75 minutes when we were given our pager.  Meanwhile, we watched countless groups of 2-4 be seated. After 75 minutes, we asked the hostesses for an update on our wait, where they let us know that we would be waiting an undetermined amount of time because there was still another group of 7 ahead of us for one of their few precious large tables. We even watched 2 groups at adjacent tables leave at the same time and requested their spot but were told there were smaller groups that had been waiting longer than us.  Either we were being lied to, or a group of 2 had been waiting an hour and a half for a table.<br>We left after waiting 1 hr 45 minutes with no idea of when we might be seated. I&#39;ll continue to patronize restaurants that have entered the civilized world of reservations and technology.
The wait at this place can be insane. Show up early, or be prepared to wait over an hour. The cheesecake is good, the food is... eh.

Food is always good and they have big portions and love their cheesecakes. But me and my boyfriend came in a Saturday knowing there would be a wait, so we came at 5pm. We were told that the wait was going to be 1 hour and 10 minutes, which we were fine with waiting. After waiting 1 hour and 35 minutes I decided to check to see where we were on the list (which I never like to be the person that always does that) and the girl looked at our pager number and looked on the computer and told us we were next up. So we stood closer to the host desk, so we were ready to go. After a table of 5, then a table of 2, then a table of 3, then another table of 2 got seated, I was getting confused and annoyed. I asked a different person why we haven&#39;t been seated and that we&#39;ve been waiting for 1 hour and 45 minutes at this point when we were told it would only be 1 hour and 10 minutes and he quickly sat us and told the other hostess that the pager wasn&#39;t ever working. While we were waiting, we saw the hostess sometime go out and call for peoples name and we have never heard our named called, even when we were told that we were next up. So I wasn&#39;t furious for waiting that long, I was furious that they gave us a pager that didn&#39;t work and didn&#39;t attempt to call our name. After we got seated, I assumed that someone told them to put our orders on rush since we waited so long, because there was a couple that got seated 5 minutes after us and we had already gotten all of our good before they received their appetizers. We felt rushed to eat our 2 appetizers to have room for our entrees. Other than one bad experience, the servers are always friendly and the food is always good.
Went here for my moms birthday. All our food came except hers. Waitress never checked back. Loud restaurant, hard to hear.  They ruined a nice birthday dinner out. Waitress was rude and impersonal.

There was a thirty minute wait on a Sunday night, with limited seating for waiting customers. We also could not wait outside because the buzzer would not work outside the front door to the restaurant.<br><br>Our server was very soft spoken and did not know the menu. When preparing to take our order for our cheesecake, he said there were a few cheesecakes not featured on the menu, but after hearing his description of the dessert, we realized that they were indeed on the menu.<br><br>The Shepard&#39;s pie was very big and very filling! The Shrimp Vietnamese spring rolls were not good. They had too many chives and only a few pieces of shrimp scattered throughout the whole dish. I had to cut the spring roll apart just to enjoy some portion of my meal. <br><br>The restaurant is nice, as they usually are. The cheesecakes were the best part of our dinner!

My mother would always take me here, and we would always share a meal and split the bill. They are pretty pricey... (I have also heard that the movie theater and this restaurant are the main things keeping Southdale mall alive) <br><br>Anyhoo... This is the first and only restaurant I have ate calamari at and loved it. It was wonderful!! I also will only eat fish and chips from two places, Here, and Mystic Lake.... <br><br>The bread is here also to die for. The place is pricey, but it&#39;s pricey for a reason. Good customer service and great food!!
Huge menu with huge portions.  The Pineapple upside down cake cheesecake is to die for. Food  and cheesecake are awesome!

I am very much a fan of cheese cake factory.  I have been to several in my travels and they are consistent with food, speed, pricing.  Waiter/Waitress speed has never been that great at any of the resturants. I not eaten anything I don&#39;t like.  Yes the sizes are huge but my family and I always plan for take home and you have lunch for the next day.  The stuffed mushrooms are awesome, crab cake sandwich, meatloaf dinner, veggie wraps etc.  Yum!!!  Drink prices are terrible. As for the desserts, we skip them.

Visited the Southdale location yesterday and was mildly impressed.<br><br>Upon entry I was pleasantly surprised by the decore. I don&#39;t know if I have actually ever been to a Cheesecake Factory and if I have it has probably been a while, so it is completely possible that subconsciously definition of The Cheesecake Factory has been slowly built through the many episodes of &#34;Big Bang Theory&#34; that I have watched. The floors are white marble, the booths and tables are constructed of some sort of dark wood, and the lighting is a bit brighter than dim which helps make this place seem more classy.<br><br>I ordered the Chicken Marsala which was served on a bed of bow tie pasta and one stray tube of penne pasta. Chicken Marsala is typically one of my favorite Itallian dishes as it offers the perfect balance of sweet and salty with the nice Marsala wine flavor. The portion that came was fairly large and came with a good amount of chicken and mushrooms and a nice brown gravy. If presentation were the only catagory I was judging this place on they would have certainly earned at least one additional star. After the first few bites I noticed that the chicken did not really have any flavor itself, and the Marsala sauce resting on the chicken was the only thing giving the dish any life at all. This immediately made me think of a large metal tin resting gently on a tub of hot water, in the kitchen, piled high with chicken breasts and &#34;chefs&#34; pulling from this pile, throwing them onto a bed of (insert pasta type here) then going over to the sauce bin, slathering the plate with (insert sauce type here), right before being served. More or less your high end production assembly line type of food service (for clarification: high end for this catagory is at best 3 stars). The Marsala sauce had nice initial flavor, unfortunately the back end tasted a bit watered down. I don&#39;t like wasting food, so I finished the chicken and mushrooms, but the pasta and watery sauce was too much for me to be able to put it down.<br><br>Being that we were at the Cheesecake Factory and that I love Cheesecake, this made for a very nice arrangement! If you are an avid Cheesecake lover such as myself they basically have every variety of cheesecake you would ever want. Fruit toppings, chocolate toppings, candy bar toppings, Orea toppings, combinations thereof, the list is endless and one should literally decide by throwing a dart into a board. We ended up with the Snickers Cheesecake and it was delicious! Had we just come here for dessert, easily 4 stars. It tasted like the whip cream was made in-house; it was nice and cold, thick, and paired very nicely with our cheesecake, and I can easily see it pairing well with fruit topped cheesecakes as well.<br><br>Overall the experience was enjoyable, I just wish the food tasted better (especially for the price), and that the server came around a bit more frequently. Their long list of cheesecakes will probably bring me back sometime in the near future, but unfortunately probably not for dinner.
Trendy, fun, and relatively unique for a chain. Great cheesecake. Nice date place. There is a patio in the summer.

We loved the decor of The Cheesecake Factory,  and we only had to wait about 20 minutes to be served on Mother&#39;s Day.  Our waiter was very friendly, efficient and helpful.  The brown oatmeal bread was delicious. Now, on to the other food.  It was just okay, and we all ordered different items.  Nothing stood out exceptionally except for the prices which are extremely high.  A beer was over seven dollars?  Are you kidding me?  Our bill came to over one hundred dollars.  The best part of the meal was my pineapple upside down cheesecake, it was yummy!!!!!!!  Probably had three thousand calories though!  It&#39;s not a bad restaurant overall, we would probably go again, but it is overpriced.

My husband and I had a superb experience at Cheesecake Factory.  It is a huge place, so the fact that there is a long wait at times tells you, people love it.  The Tuxedo Cheesecake was magnificient!  We did eat early on a weeknight so there was NO wait.  Server was great, helped us with recommendations and was very attentive.  Definitely will go again.  Check out the menu online before you go, it will help you decide from the many choices.

Service is a tad slow, which is a bummer. It&#39;s always busy and is a chaotic mess at times...Bringing in large groups also is a headache. If you do plan on going, be prepared to wait. The wait can last 5 minutes or an hour. However, the food is good (I encourage the Spicy Chicken Chipotle pasta) and the cheesecake is delicious. Been there a handful of times and can&#39;t complain too much.
Had the Mexican tortilla salad, under 590 calories and super, super good and big!

I went because I had a gift card. Otherwise, I probably wouldn&#39;t have gone. <br>And well, I am torn on the rating. <br>I will start with the positives- <br>-The cheesecake is knock your socks off orgasmically wonderful. I don&#39;t care if &#34;orgasmically&#34; is a word or not! <br>The ok&#39;s- <br>-The food. It&#39;s alright, although it&#39;s difficult to say a club sandwich is worth $11.95. It should never be more than $5.95! <br>-The service. It was alright. Wasn&#39;t bad, wasn&#39;t wonderful. <br>The negatives- <br>-Location. Southdale is always packed, for whatever reason. It&#39;s tough to find a convenient parking spot. Which can be a plus I guess, to work off the 5 billion fat grams on the hike back to your car after eating a piece of cheesecake! <br>-I don&#39;t like Edina, but that&#39;s just me. <br>-Seating....we were seated at a tiny little table that was about 6 inches from each table beside us.  It was like dining with strangers.  Not easy to have a private conversation when you have strangers a foot away.  Who, by the way were fine on the right side, but weird as hell on the left.  They actually started questioning us about our food choices right as our food was brought to the table.  I was like, bitch, I am hungry, shut up so I can eat and mind your own business.  I didn&#39;t say this out loud, but it felt good to say it in my head.<br>-A little on the spendy side (see above comment on the $11.95 club sandwich) <br>So, whatever. I got a kick ass piece of cheesecake. I also could of saved the trip and the money on the rest of the meal and picked up some Cheesecake Factory at my local Super Target where they sell it in their bakery.

if the amplificatIon of your ass is the objective then the place deserves 10 stars.  <br><br>the portions are large enough to feed a reasonably sized village the menus are chock full of adverts and I wouldn&#39;t be surprised if they actually piped in additional crowd noise while you&#39;re dining.  <br><br>i&#39;ve seen people order a salad (appetizer sized portion) and then cancel the order for the entree when the app salad arrives.  this is all about excess and it feels cheap and then you get the bill and then you realize, you really did have a weeks worth of groceries on your plate. so in terms of mass it was actually a good deal. <br><br>good for groups, horrible for dates. think chilis with more noise, italian food, more ads and a wide range of tangential dishes all of mediocre quality.   that this place is in edina should surprise no one.

Look, I don&#39;t normally seek this place out, but I went for lunch with two friends today. I remember from past visits the food being OK, and most big chains will at least be able to get you lunch without much problem. Not here. Our service was incompetent. It took about 10 minutes just to get drinks, and another 10 for someone to take our order. We were given silverware, bread (which was basically stale), and a tablemate received her side of salad dressing for her salad. About 20 minutes later our server came by with dessert menus. The hell? We reminded him we ordered food and had not received it. 15 minutes later, were told food would be out &#34;soon.&#34; It came after about another 15 minutes. The guy was in a daze the whole time, and just appeared clueless. We were told that if we wanted to order dessert it would be comped, so I guess that&#39;s sort of redeeming. So we each ordered dessert, just on principle. It was noon on a Saturday, and the place was about 1/2 full of people, and there were plenty of servers. <br>Anyway, the food is meh, but there is a lot of variety (almost to a fault.), and you&#39;ll get an OK meal.

Raspberry lemonade was good, portions are big, good service, and good atmosphere. However, food was not that great. Nothing really stood out to me. Cheesecake is good if you like unusual flavors, but for a plain cheesecake it&#39;s just average.

Last Tuesday I went to dine here at 8:30 pm. The waiter seemed very nice and we got our drinks after a few minutes. I ordered the raspberry lemonade and it was so incredibly sour I could not drink it. I asked for the hibiscus instead. It took 30 minutes for that to come out.  When our food came, it was not what I ordered. The waiter who brought out the food told me he would have the manager come talk to us, that never happened. The waiter came back after 10 minutes and I told him the order was wrong and he said &#34;Oh yeah those 2 are right next to each other in the computer, I&#39;ll get it changed&#34;. This would&#39;ve been fine if they just re-fired the food right away. I know, working in the industry in the past, that you need to let the kitchen and manager know when you mess up an order so they can get it pushed to the front and it won&#39;t take long to make. I ordered the chicken picatta and it took ANOTHER 40 MINUTES for me to receive my food. By this time my date was done with his food (I told him not to wait).  We only saw the waiter during these couple times and he never came back to check on us and we never  saw the manager. Finally, the bill came and we were charged for BOTH drinks I had ordered even though I did not even drink the first one! He said he couldn&#39;t take it off the bill since it came to the table.. WHAT?!  For all the time we wasted (it wasn&#39;t even busy) this was not worth it. We weren&#39;t offered a discount or even free cheesecake or anything for all we went through. Luckily the food is good, but next time I am ordering to-go and won&#39;t dine in.
Food was very greasy and salty. (Fish and Yam Fries).  Pineapple upside down cheesecake was great.
